One attacker was shot and captured.

Others killed were his younger brother, security aides and political associates. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility for the attack.

notes: Suspected members of Islamist group Boko Haram have killed at least five people and burnt immigration offices in a Nigerian town on the border with Cameroon.

notes: A JTF task force raids a Boko Haram hideout, kills four and makes 13 arrests.

notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack customers of a bakery, five dead. Police kill one sect member was he tried to escape. This happened in the Polo neighborhood of the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A photographer at Sharada Kwanar Ganduje area in Kano was shot dead by unidentified gunmen, suspected to be members of the Boko Haram militants.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A Spanish doctor who was kidnapped on April 4th is released unharmed.

notes: Nigerian Forces have shot dead two suspected Boko Haram members who allegedly attacked and killed five bakery workers last week.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched an attack on the home of a retired civil servant, five dead. Police respond and kill two of the assailants.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launched an attack on a beer parlor killing five and injuring six others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Following two morning attacks a third is detonated in the Ungwan Muazu area of the state. Two injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suicide bombers in the Nigerian capital Abuja detonated their ordinance in a newspaper office. 37 killed, 100 injured. Conflicting reports on the number of deaths, many have the number as low a 10. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility, threatening further attacks on media offices around the country.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A bomb and gun attack on a theatre used for Sunday church services at a university has left at least 19 people dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram shoot and kill four traders in Yobe State.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack cattle trading market for the second time in a week. At least 50 reported dead, but the number was expected to climb.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
source: The Press Trust of India Limited
notes: Gunmen believed to be from radical Islamist sect kill 2 guards in a prison break, free 23 prisoners.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Three people were on Sunday night killed when gunmen opened fire on residents of Tukuntawa area of Kano.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Attacks in north-east Nigeria believed to have been carried out by radical Islamist sect Boko Haram killed at least seven police officers. The attack also struck the home of a former senator.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A local political official receives several threats via text message from a militant group, suspected to be Boko Haram. The messages were alerting the officials of plans to bomb the police station in the town, the Otukpo Main Market and St Marys Church, among others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: An explosive thrown by suspected members of Islamist Boko Haram sect on at patrolling soldiers damaged some houses in a city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen killed a Muslim cleric and a retired prison guard on Saturday in northeastern Nigeria, residents and a medic said, amid a wave of such killings blamed on Islamist group Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Armed bandits suspected to be members of radical Islamic sect Boko Haram killed 10 people as they attacked a bakery on the outskirts of Maiduguri town in Nigeria today, witnesses said. Residents say the attackers came in the wee hours of the morning and killed mostly Christian workers of the bakery, then took an unknown amount of money as they left.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two civilians are killed by suspected Boko Haram at Abaganaram market.

notes: Three are killed in a hotel bar at the hands of suspected Boko Haram.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: At people were killed and 40 or more injured when a suicide bomber attacked a church. Boko Haram claimed responsibility in the days that followed. Conflicting accounts have the death toll at nine and injured number at 35, while others have the toll at three.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Forces shot dead 16 militants in a fire fight with Islamist sect Boko Haram. A Reuters reporter heard gunfire and explosions echoing through the remote city of Maiduguri.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram opened fire and killed a retired deputy inspector-general of Nigerias federal police, as well as two other officers in the city.

Eight killed, 24 injured. Some reports have the death count seven, while others, eight. Earlier in the day another suicide bomber detonated himself near a school elsewhere in the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Three Boko Haram gunmen enter a church and open fire on congregants. At least one dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

There was a shootout between the gunmen and policemen which lasted till 10 pm (2100 GMT)," a witness said. "There were a lot of gunshots lasting for more than an hour. notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen stormed into a Maiduguri market, shot and killed and trader, wounded two others.

notes: Fourteen members of Boko Haram and one police officer are shot and killed in a shootout after the sect attempted to rob a bank. Four Boko Haram corpses were recovered by police, while the other ten were carried away by the sect to conceal their identities.

notes: Gunmen, believed to be Boko Haram, opened fire on a Baptist Church during Christmas service, killing six church members.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram kill five civilians around 1am. Some were shot, while others were "killed." Some reports claim fifteen were killed in the attack.

notes: Gunmen, believed to be of Boko Haram, attacked a military post containing telecom masts, an often sought target. One soldier reported dead due to the attack. Following the attack on the military base the same suspected group attacked a primary school in the area.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram enters a village between 1 and 3am, executes five persons in their houses. Other reports have the death figure at 15.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Security forces exchange fire with suspected members of Boko Haram, two dead, including a civilian.

The reasons for the abduction is unknown.

Boko Haram also attacked a nearby police station killing 22 police officers, 14 prison officials and three civilians. It is not clear if the civilians were specifically targeted, or if they were victims of cross fire. 105 prisoners were freed as a result of the attack on the police post. Leadership reports for the deaths of 55, though only 41 were specifically accounted for. It was later revealed by Boko Haram that they had kidnapped several "women and children" during the attack.

notes: Boko Haram shoots and kills a security official of the Department of State Security Services (SSS) in Ajilari/Gomari airport ward of Maiduguri on the evening of 24/05. The gunmen arrived at the scene with AK-47 hidden in their clothes before they fired then fled the scene.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen shot and killed a shop owner and his son in Chescon area for unknown reason. It is believed the father was targeted, his son was killed by a stray bullet.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Security forces kill three suspected members of Boko Haram and arrest 25 during a raid on their hideout.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A lieutenant of a Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau is discovered dead in the Lake Chad area by police. It is not clear if he was victim of a government military offensive, or Boko Haram infighting.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill the District Head of Dala Alamderi Ward in front of his wife and children.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attacked the villages of Hrazah and Hembe in Gwoza, killing a district head and burning two churches.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacked Niamey prison and attacked Salafis prisoners. Niger troops surrounded the prison and a clash ensued. 3 died, 3 prison guards injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram kidnapped the father of the Borno State Commissioner for Women Affairs, Hajiya Inna Galadima, Alhaji Galadima. It is not clear if the kidnapping was expressly political.

notes: Military forces shot and killed eight members of Boko Haram in Maiduguri.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram kills 13 members of a youth vigilante group opposed to the sect. The vigilante group typically provides information against Boko Haram to security forces. actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suspected Boko Haram explosive at a church is discovered by police and dismantled before it was allowed to detonate.

notes: Members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Hwaa, Kunde, Gathahure and Gjigga in the Gwoza area torching four churches with Improvised Explosives Devices (IEDS) and petro-bombs. At least two deaths, including a clergyman.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Three soldiers are critically wounded in a Boko Haram attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Nine students are killed by Boko Haram gunmen as they sat taking an exam. The attack occurred at the Ansarudeen School, in the Jajeri suburb of the city. Boko Haram said the attack was to punish the students for helping the army.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Arrests: Members of a vigilante group apprehend 31 Boko Haram suspects in the Bulabulin, Anguwan Doki, Shuwari and Gamboru Market areas of Maiduguri.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Boko Haram renews attacks on communities of the Gwoza, killing 15. The villages attacked were Gathahure, Hwaa, Tihezeh, Hrazah, Hembe and Gjigga.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Military Forces, accompanied by the Civilian JTF, severely beat 35 suspected members of Boko Haram with crude weapons after a short screening process in Bama. The soldiers forced the victims to like on the ground before carrying out sentence. Following the beatings the soldiers and vigilantes shot their weapons into the air in celebration then moved the detainees into nearby barracks. Several days later, on the afternoon of 29 July, military personnel took the men out of the barracks where they shot them dead, several at a time, before dumping their corpses.

The attack appeared to be in reprisal for the recent arrests of Boko Haram members. The attack occurred in the town of Gamboru Ngala near the border with Cameroon. It is not clear if the intended target of the attackers was the police or civilians.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Posing as members of the military, Boko Haram entered Bama, gathered members of a local vigilante group, and shot them. The killings are likely a form of revenge against local Boko Haram push back. Varying sources hold different causality accounts.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Agbena and Agbaaga villages of Borikyo ward in Ukum Local Government area, killing 18. The motivation for the attack is not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram shoots and kills six villagers in Damasak as they slept.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Six members of the youth vigilante group, popularly called Civilian JTF or BVYG in Borno State, were shot dead by suspected members of Boko Haram in the border town of Damasak, Mobar Local Government Area of the state.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram kills 14 Shuwa Arab fighters after they came to assist the embattled BVYG.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: No fewer than 24 members of the Borno youth vigilante popularly known as Civilian JTF were at the weekend killed by suspected Boko Haram members in Mungono local government area of the state. The group was said to be on their way to the hideouts of the Boko Haram sect in Kaleri, Shuwari, Maganari and Nannari villages when they were ambushed and killed. Many other members of the vigilante group are at present unaccounted for. Many civilians were also killed in the attacks.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Seventeen civilians are killed by Boko Haram when they came to the aid of the BVYG.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram's members attacked a nomadic Shuwa-Arab village (not named) and shot dead 17 herdsmen.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Konduga and Nganzai local government areas, killing 24 over two days. In retaliation military forces pursued the perpetrators to their camps near Gajiram with air support and about 50 insurgents were killed in a shootout.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen killed a top aid to the Borno State governor along with eight others and abducted a family of five at Bulabulin-Ngabura Village, 50km from Maiduguri.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram stormed the northeast Borno town of Gajiran, opening fire in a market and killing 15 people, all of which were civilian. The attackers also laid siege to a police post and a government building.

notes: Twenty Boko Haram gunmen with explosives and rocket-propelled grenades attacked a police station in the northeast, killing two officers and injuring another.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Members of Boko Haram, dressed in military uniform, attack Benisheik town late into the evening causing at least 142 deaths and the destruction of may homes and businesses. The motive of the attack my be linked to the towns support of the BVYG, a vigilante group which fights against the sect. The following week the group accepted formal responsibility.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents dressed in military uniforms set up checkpoints in an attack in a western Borno location known as Benishiek, 70km from Maiduguri, attacking residents and motorists. An unknown number of people were killed.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Eight people were killed and about 17 others suffered severe gunshot wounds when a combined team of soldiers and State Security Service (SSS) operatives sacked a purported Boko Haram enclave in an uncompleted building around Zone E, Apo Legislative Quarters, Abuja. Eye witnesses and some residents in the area told Weekly Trust that the incident occurred between 11 pm and 1 am on the night of 19/09-20/09.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents have soldiers, police and civilians in Buni Yadi, after they entered the town late in the evening and began shooting sporadically near a police post. The son of the Yobe Peoples Democratic Partys (PDP) youth leader Alhaji Ado Bomboy was killed in the attack while many shops, houses and two telecommunications masts were also razed. It is not clear if the attackers, numbering 50, had a particular civilian or military target in mind. 100 "feared" dead.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Six are killed and property destroyed in Fulatari due to a suspected Boko Haram attack.

notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram attack a Christian church in Dorawa, killing the pastor and his two children.

The motivation for the attack is not clear.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: The military air forces in Yobe State have killed "scores" of members of the Boko Haram sect and arrested 15 in connection with the killing of students in College of Agriculture, Gujba.

notes: Suspected members of Boko Haram open fire at a Mosque, killing seven. The gunmen had sounded the call for prayer earlier than scheduled, luring the victims to their death.

notes: A dusk attack on military barracks 20km outside of Damaturu causes a initial report of 106 deaths, all but two combatants, in its five hour duration. A local hospital later confirmed 35 fatalities. The military structure was completely destroyed. Some reports hold as high as 127 fatalities between the two clashes in the Damaturu area.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Dressed in military uniform, Boko Haram (who later claimed responsibility) stuck the city of Maiduguri during the morning, attacking the main military barracks, freeing prisoners and causing panicked residents to flee. Soldiers engaged in a shootout with the insurgents near the main Giwa Military Barracks in the citys Fauri area. Following the initial attack (for which causality figures are not known) military forces along with the "Civilian JTF captured several of recently freed inmates, regained control of the effected areas of the city and extra judicially executed 600 in various locations across Maiduguri, mainly in the school houses from which they were held. The fact that the executed inmates were members of Boko Haram is a matter of dispute.

notes: Scores of Boko Haram gunmen riding in armoured vehicles razed the border village of Gambaru and opened fire on residents who tried to flee into neighbouring Cameroon. Witnesses report the insurgents targeted a local market, where they fired sporadically into the crowd before proceeding to the town to wreak more havoc. Additionally, several other persons were also injured in the attack, while almost all the houses and shops in the town were burnt down. At least 300 reported dead. The attack occurred during the evening hours. The bridge linking Nigerian with Cameroon was also destroyed in the attack.

The attacks were brought to a halt by the deployment of the fighter jets that dropped bombs on the insurgents, which occurred as late as 4pm. Xinhua reports 12 deaths in the raids.

The initial attack occurred at 9am when a gang of Boko Haram gunmen on a cattle-rustling mission pretended to be Fulani herdsmen and suddenly opened fire on the members of the VGN who were on patrol.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram militants have abducted more than 60 women and girls in Kummabza village in the Damboa district of Borno state. Four villagers, who tried to escape were shot dead on the spot. The abduction could be an attempt by the group to refocus attention on its demands for the release of militant fighters - Boko Haram has indicated that it would be willing to release the 219 schoolgirls that it has held hostage since April 14 in exchange for the freedom of its brothers in arms currently held in Nigerian jails.

notes: Boko Haram fighters clashed with Cameroonian military forces after they interrupted their raid. Seven police officers and a gendarme are believed kidnapped, and a soldier and commander of the Bonderi gendarmie were also seriously injured.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Heavily armed Boko Haram fighters killed 11 during a cross-border raid.

notes: Boko Haram attacks Mafa, date not known, ~17/08. The attack may have been in conjunction with an attack on Dikwa.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A security official reports seeing corpses (numbers not known) in Marte on 17/08. It is not clear when the date of the attack was. Boko Haram is blamed for the attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Riding motorcycles, members of Boko Haram attack Dikwa. "They killed many people (numbers not known) and destroyed many houses." The attack is believed to be in revenge for the town rising up against Boko Haram by mobilising vigilante militias. Date of the attack is vague.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Alabanya and Kaje in a series of coordinated attacks throughout the region. Causalities are reported, numbers not known. Exact date is not known, ~17/08.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks Ala in a suspected coordinated attack that extends "between Dikwa and Marte towns." Causalities reported, but are not town specific and are not enumerated. Date is vague.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: 3 people were killed and 15 abducted after a raid by Boko Haram on a northern border village. They also stole supplies and burned down the villages primary school.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attack and overtake Buni Yadi, raising their flag over the town. Of any deaths three are known - two villagers were executed for smoking cigarettes, a third for dealing drugs. Many other residents have fled to neighbouring towns. Date(s) of the attack not entirely known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram insurgents have taken over the Police Mobile Training camp - a police academy - in Limankara village. It was gathered that there was heavy fighting between the insurgents and troops before the camp finally fell. It is believed Boko Haram targeted the facility after reported attempts from security forces to dislodge Boko Harams control from Gwoza, which had fallen under BH control several weeks earlier. Numerous trainees ("scores") were killed or seriously injured by the attackers, no numbers provided. It was later determined by Vanguard that 35 officers were declared missing following the attack. Following the takeover a video was released by the group declaring a caliphate in the area.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Banki. Many military members managed to escape and fled towards Amhide villages before they entered Cameroon for safety. Causalities not known, however, sources said many casualties were recorded including Boko Haram, security operatives and civilians who were caught up in the crossfire.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram takes over Madagali town of Adamawa State, including a Catholic Church building. "Dozens" killed. Exact date not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attack and overtake Gamboru and Ngala towns, along the border with Cameroon. The attack began on a base in Gamboru, causing the 480 members of the military to flee into Cameroon, fifteen deaths reported. The also caused all military forces in nearby Ngala to flee as well, allowing Boko Haram to enter that town without resistance. In a response to the attacks, the Nigerian Air Force jet later dropped a massive bomb in the middle of Gamboru after hovering for several minutes in the air. The jet then left while the militants began a house-to-house raid in Gamboru. The attack occurred early in the morning. The attackers later attempted to destroy a bridge linking Nigeria with Cameroon.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram members reportedly took over Bama town - the second largest town in the state - and hoisted the sects flag, following a gun battle between they and Nigerian soldiers. "Scores" killed before soldiers fled the city alongside civilians - thousands displaced. Military sources who spoke to journalists in Maiduguri said the soldiers were able to kill about 70 of the militants and injure about 30 others. Some reports have the death total as high as 130. The number of soldiers and civilians killed are not known. Despite several sources reporting the fall a Bama to Boko Haram, Xinhua and This Day (Lagos) reports the military repelled the attack, the latter describing the battle as Boko Harams "Waterloo." It is possible Boko Haram retreated, regrouped, and attacked again. A military airstrike was involved in the battle.

notes: Following an assault on Michika by Boko Haram, military forces launch a campaign to liberate the city, which included an air assault. actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launches a "massive" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the causality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the pilot was later captured by Boko Haram, who nearly a month later released a video of his beheading.

Boko Haram fighters killed at least 70 soldiers in a fierce battle between they and Nigerian troops for control of the towns of Bazza and Vimtim in Adamawa State. notes: Boko Haram launches a major attack on Baga, eventually taking over the town after military forces abandoned a base. Exact causality figures are not known, though most estimates are near 100. Boko Haram attack villagers throughout the week causing mass causalities.

notes: Military forces attempt to retake Baga town, which had been captured by Boko Haram the previous day. Clashes reported; state military forces were eventually pushed back. "Significant" Boko Haram deaths reported. Throughout the day Boko Haram continued their assault on civilian in the city.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A sustained, several day-long attack (3-4 days) of residents by Boko Haram of the held town of Baga. Early estimates have 2,000 dead throughout the week, though this figure may be a total count in the entire area throughout the week. A witness claimed the majority of the dead were the old, women and children. The town was destroyed following the several attacks through out the week. 3,200 displaced. Conflicting report: Despite the high casualties government officials claim no more that 150 dead.

notes: Troops from the 7 Division of the Nigerian Army, clashed with suspected Boko Haram insurgents at Mainari village, not far from Kawuri in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State. A credible source described the encounter as "a bad outing" stressing that troops had to retreat when it was evident that going further would not yield positive result. Causalities not known.

notes: The Chadian and Niger armies, which are positioned in the southeastern part of Niger, launched a large scale air and ground offensive on Nigerian territory very early on Sunday [8 March] against Boko Haram positions opposite the Niger cities of Diffa and Bosso. The militaries reported Boko Haram small arms fire shortly after crossing the Doutchi Bridge, which leads to Nigeria from southern Niger. A military source stated that before the ground attack, the air force attacked [Boko Haram positions] in the area for two days. 200 Boko Haram reported dead, 10 Chadian soldiers killed (Agence France Presse). It is not clear if the dead are accounted from the land forces or air bombings from the two previous days.

The operation is believed to have begun on 09/04, possibly before.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacked Dabanga village and killed three civilians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram fighters attacked a Cameroonian military position and burned down houses in Amchide but were repulsed without reported casualties.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram militants, the deadly Islamist sect, has attacked two villages - Bia and Blaberi - overnight in northern Cameroon. Most recent death toll indicates 19 people killed in the violence; many of the victims decapitated.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram militants, the deadly Islamist sect, has killed no fewer than 10 people in overnight attacks on two villages in northern Cameroon. There were consecutive attacks by Boko Haram in Bia and Blaberi in the district of Kolofata in the early morning, the military reported.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Six soldiers and a civilian vigilante were injured when their vehicle hit a mine planted by Boko Haram just outside the town of Baga.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Several people are feared (numbers not known) killed as twin suicide blasts from suspected Boko Haram hit the Global System Communication (GSM) market in Potiskum. Another unsuccessful blast occurred in the Dogo Tebo, which killed only the bomber.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Military forces engage in an gun battle with Boko Haram in Alagarno, causing several causalities, including a commander known as Abu Mojahid. Exact causality figures not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Two soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram rocket attack on a military vehicle in the northeast Nigerian town of Baga.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A Boko Haram landmine kills a soldier and three unidentified vigilantes in Sambisa Forest, causing the soldiers to retreat.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.

notes: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.

notes: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press
notes: Boko Haram attacked a Nigerien army position on the island Karamga on Lake Chad, resulting in the deaths at a reported 46 soldiers, 28 civilians and 156 militants. 32 troops are missing. Nigers military maintains control of the island and has asked residents to evacuate.
Suspected Boko Haram attack and kill 21 civilians in Bultram.
Military forces report they have killed "several" Boko Haram commanders in an operation in Sambisa. The raid came nearly 24 hours after an operation that rescued several hostages in the area.

Military forces rescues an additional 234 women and girls from a Boko Haram stronghold in Sambisa Forest. The operations against Boko Haram included overrunning their controlled areas of Tokumbere, Wulari Bukar, Gangala, Anguwar Bakwai, Jigide, Kotorima, Lagura Bello and Lagina Fulani. The nature of any violence is not clear, though military command reports the death of at least one soldier.

Military forces rescues an additional 234 women and girls from a Boko Haram stronghold in Sambisa Forest. The operations against Boko Haram included overrunning their controlled areas of Tokumbere, Wulari Bukar, Gangala, Anguwar Bakwai, Jigide, Kotorima, Lagura Bello and Lagina Fulani. The nature of any violence is not clear, though military command reports the death of at least one soldier.
Boko Haram killed at least five civilians and burned houses and vehicles in an attack on Koukoudou village. They also looted homes and shops before withdrawing back into Nigeria.

Nigerian forces rescue 25 additional captives of Boko Haram in Sambisa Forest during a security operation in which "many militants" were killed in "a fierce encounter" that cost the life of one soldier and wounded five. Military forces also report they destroyed seven Boko Haram camps including four in Alafa, Rogo Fulani, Laraga and others used as training camps. Exact causality figures not known.

Nigerian forces rescue 25 additional captives of Boko Haram in Sambisa Forest during a security operation in which "many militants" were killed in "a fierce encounter" that cost the life of one soldier and wounded five. Military forces also report they destroyed seven Boko Haram camps including four in Alafa, Rogo Fulani, Laraga and others used as training camps. Exact causality figures not known.

A gunman/suicide bomber suspected to be Boko Haram opened fire on Friday (08/05) outside a school in northeast city of Potiskum, seriously wounding 12 students. Only the bomber was confirmed killed. Later reports confirmed a total of three deaths, plus the bomber (Leadership).

source: Agence France Presse - English; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: A Cameroonian soldier was killed and two others injured while on patrol in the far north when they were ambused by Boko Haram militants.
Boko Haram clashed with the Cameroonian military on a patrol near Zevelet, killing two soldiers, and injuring three soldiers and a civilian. The military returned fire, killing around 60 militants.

Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female sucide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.

Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female sucide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.

Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female sucide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.
At least eight people were killed in Gur village of Biu local government area of Borno State as a group of Boko Haram insurgents invaded the community at about 12 midnight.
Boko Haram attack Mule location outside of Maiduguri, causalities not known.
Boko Haram overtakes Marte, casualties not known.
Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari Hyembula of Madagali, kills three and abducts seven.
A twelve year-old girl detonates a suicide pack at a Damaturu bus depot killing seven (some sources 8) in injuring 31. Boko Haram is believed to be involved.

Boko Haram members on May 18, 2015 evening reportedly attacked Madagali community in Adamawa State, and killed about 24 people. They also abducted women and children, even as they reportedly destroyed houses and other properties during the attack on the community.
Eight are dead following a Boko Haram suicide attack at a market in Garkida, Adamawa.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack Madagail, kill 12 and injure others.
A suicide bomber strikes a cattle marker in Garkida, Gombi LGA, ten dead plus injuries. Boko Haram suspected.

Days following a Fulani attack on Barikin Ladi LGA, members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Ropp (on 20/05) and Inding (on 21/05). Nine dead in Ropp, seven in Inding, many structures burnt and destroyed. Despite the itemised number of dead in each town the source reported a total of 27 dead. This could be interpreted as a count in the larger area throughout the week.

Days following a Fulani attack on Barikin Ladi LGA, members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Ropp (on 20/05) and Inding (on 21/05). Nine dead in Ropp, seven in Inding, many structures burnt and destroyed. Despite the itemised number of dead in each town the source reported a total of 27 dead. This could be interpreted as a count in the larger area throughout the week.
Military forces kill "scores" of Boko Haram fighters and rescued 20 of their hostages in a raid in Sambisa Forest. One soldier died while 10 others were wounded in the assault on rebel bases.
Boko Haram attacks the village of Jwamda-Kobla in Madagali the early morning of 22/05. Causalities not known.
Boko Haram attacks Kamburo Karaga, killing 10 residents. Date vague - the attack took place "at the weekend."
A number of Boko Haram fighters aged between 12 and 16 attacked Gubio the evening of 24/05, killing 37 residents and destroying over 400 homes.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram on Mafa, killing 30, including a foreign-born commander. The commander was discovered to have thousands of Euros on his person.
Boko Haram attacked Chadian military forces on the island of Choua in Lake Chad. 4 soldiers and 33 militants were killed.
Chadian military planes targeted Boko haram positions on Lake Chad and destroyed food, fuel, and munitions belonging to the insurgents.
Chadian military planes targeted Boko haram positions on Lake Chad and destroyed food, fuel, and munitions belonging to the insurgents.
Suspected Boko Haram target a wedding in Tashon Alade with a suicide blast. Six deaths reported.

Boko Haram attack Maiduguri with a series of RPGs, military forces retaliate, forcing the attackers into retreat. The fighting was most heavily concentrated in the Dala suburb to the south of the city. Between 7-15 causalities reported from the grenade attacks.

Boko Haram attack Maiduguri with a series of RPGs, military forces retaliate, forcing the attackers into retreat. The fighting was most heavily concentrated in the Dala suburb to the south of the city. Causalities not known.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack at a market area in Maiduguri, killing 13, injuring 24. Some sources count the dead as many as 20.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers killed at least 31 people and injured 38 others in a crowded market in the northeast Nigeria city of Yola on 04/06.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide blast kills four soldiers at a military checkpoint in Maiduguri on 04/06.
Military forces shoot and kill two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers in Shettimari.
A bomb kills 16 in Musari, outside of Maiduguri. Boko Haram suspected. Most of the dead were traders.
Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Ungwan Keke-B village in Chikun local government area. One Boko Haram death reported.
Suspected Boko Haram female suicide bomber detonated along Baga/Monguno (likely in Marte), killing herself and two others.
Fifteen are dead and several buildings destroyed when Boko Haram gunmen attacked Huyum village on 08/06.
Boko Haram attacks the Sambisa Forest villages of Matangale, Buraltima and Dirmanti of Borno on 09/06, opening fire on villagers before looting and burning homes. 43 reported dead.
Two Cameroonian soldiers were killed and around 20 injured when Boko Haram attacked using grenades in the far north.

"Several" Boko Haram were killed early in the day when Boko Haram attacked Babbangida, headquarters of Tarmowa (Tarmua) LGA of Yobe State. [Boko Haram] stormed the town around 6:00am, shooting, burning government buildings and burning several shops.

Eight are killed when a Boko Haram suicide bomber target the office of a Potiskum vigilante group known as "Alhaji Ardo" during mid-day in the Igwanda area. A second bomber killed two targeting a Dorawa area brothel.
During a Boko Haram attack on a village in the Bosso region, the militants killed at least one and kidnapping two boys.
Boko Haram attacked Dabanga and Ngassa, stealing supplies and taking hostages. Two security personnel died and many were injured in pursuit of the militants.

Eight are killed when a Boko Haram suicide bomber target the office of a Potiskum vigilante group known as "Alhaji Ardo" during mid-day in the Igwanda area. A second bomber killed two targeting a Dorawa area brothel.
Boko Haram attacked a village in the Bosso region, clashing with defense forces.

source: Leadership (Abuja); Associated Press International; Deutsche Welle; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Suicide bombers on motorcycles simultaneously attacked police headquarters and the national police academy, killing at least 23 immediately, with a final death toll of 37. They also wounded more than 100 others and security agents returned fire. At least four of the dead were suspected Boko Haram fighters.
Boko Haram attacked Dabanga and Ngassa, stealing supplies and taking hostages. Two security personnel died and many were injured in pursuit of the militants.

Several people are dead (including members of a vigilante group) when a Boko Haram bomb exploded during the early evening of 16/06. The death total was later raised to 71 as the week progressed (Daily Trust - Abuja).

In response to Boko Harams attack on Gueskerou on June 17, the Nigerien military launched ground and air operations from June 18 - 23. The offensive left 15 militants dead, 20 arrested, and a number of vehicles destroyed, with no injuries reported on the part of the army.

source: Associated Press International; Xinhua News Agency - French; Agence France Presse - English
notes: Boko Haram attacked Lamana and a neighboring village with guns, setting homes on fire and killing at least 38 people, including 10 children.

In response to Boko Harams attack on Gueskerou on June 17, the Nigerien military launched ground and air operations from June 18 - 23. The offensive left 15 militants dead, 20 arrested, and a number of vehicles destroyed, with no injuries reported on the part of the army.

In response to Boko Harams attack on Gueskerou on June 17, the Nigerien military launched ground and air operations from June 18 - 23. The offensive left 15 militants dead, 20 arrested, and a number of vehicles destroyed, with no injuries reported on the part of the army.

In response to Boko Harams attack on Gueskerou on June 17, the Nigerien military launched ground and air operations from June 18 - 23. The offensive left 15 militants dead, 20 arrested, and a number of vehicles destroyed, with no injuries reported on the part of the army.

In response to Boko Harams attack on Gueskerou on June 17, the Nigerien military launched ground and air operations from June 18 - 23. The offensive left 15 militants dead, 20 arrested, and a number of vehicles destroyed, with no injuries reported on the part of the army.

A pair of female suicide bombers attack Baga Market in Maiduguri on 22/06 killing at least 35 and injuring more than 50. It was gathered that one of the women in her early 20s hid explosives beneath a veil and attempted attacking a Jumaat mosque outside the fish market. A security official said the attack had the hallmark of the Boko Haram.
Boko Haram fighters stormed Debiro Hawul in Nigerias north-eastern state of Borno on Monday (22/06), shooting sporadically and razing houses. An estimated 22 dead.

In response to Boko Harams attack on Gueskerou on June 17, the Nigerien military launched ground and air operations from June 18 - 23. The offensive left 15 militants dead, 20 arrested, and a number of vehicles destroyed, with no injuries reported on the part of the army.
Boko Haram killed five people and injured four others in an attack on a town near Bosso. The militants used guns and set fire to victims, homes, and vehicles as well as the central market.
On 23/06, 20 people are dead in an assault on Debiro Biu. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrators. A similar attack occurred on the previous day.

At least five people have been killed and 10 wounded after a suicide bomber blew himself up outside a leprosy hospital during the early evening hours on the outskirts of the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Alwihda website;
notes: After an exchange of gunfire, police arrested Boko Harams leader for Chad and Northern Cameroon, Baana fanay alias Mahamat Moustapha, with at least two of his accomplices.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Alwihda website
notes: Six militants blew themselves up, initially killing themselves as well as five Chadian police officers and injuring at least one other, during a police operation launched Monday against Boko Haram. The death toll was later revised upwards to 13.
Military forces launch an aerial bombardment on Boko Haram position in Monguno LGA, casualties not known. The attack reportedly prompted Boko Haram to target civilians in Kukawa and Monguno villages.

Two suicide bombers detonate themselves in near a hospital in the Molai section of Maiduguri on 01/07, two civilians injured. The attack came at a time when the vice-president was visiting the city. The same hospital was targeted on 27/06.

Boko Haram launched a coordinated attack against three Borno villages on 01/07: Kukawa (97 dead) and two small, unidentified villages near Monguno (48 dead). The attacks occurred in the night-time hours. Boko Haram entered the villages after fleeing an aerial bombardment by military forces in Monguno LGA. Conflicting accounts claim many of the deaths occurred when members of a vigilante group discovered a number of Boko Haram IEDs, which exploded in their presence.

Boko Haram launched a coordinated attack against three Borno villages on 01/07: Kukawa (97 dead) and two small, unidentified villages near Monguno (48 dead). The attacks occurred in the night-time hours. Boko Haram entered the villages after fleeing an aerial bombardment by military forces in Monguno LGA. Conflicting accounts claim many of the deaths occurred when members of a vigilante group discovered a number of Boko Haram IEDs, which exploded in their presence.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Malari and Alaw villages in Konduga Local Government Area on 02/07. At least 13 dead and 21 injured.
Boko Haram forces attack Maiduguri on 03/07, but are repelled by military forces and the "Civilian JTF." Causalities not known.
Boko Haram invades Mussa "B" village on 03/07 killing 29 residents, plus injuries. The attack occurred midday.
Boko Haram attacks Koshebe village in Mafa LGA on 03/07. Causalities not known. "Scores killed" in the attack.

In the early hours of 03/07 Boko Haram insurgents reportedly trailed about 13 of their defecting members and killed 11 of them in Miringa village in Biu Local Government Area of Borno State. Sources said the defecting members were forcefully conscripted by Boko Haram several months ago.
Boko Haram attacks Bama on 03/07. Causalities not known.
At least 55 people have been killed in a 04/07 attack by Boko Haram suicide bombers in Zabamari, Jere LGA, 6 miles from Maiduguri.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Memorom on Lake Chad, killing at least 3 and wounding around 12.
A female Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a school in Zaria, killing 25 (later raised to 37) and injuring 32.

source: Radio France Internationale; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: Boko Haram attacked the village of Bodo in the extreme north but were repelled by military forces, who killed 3-24 militants.
Boko Haram clashed with a vigilante patrol in the Mayo-Sava department, leaving three vigilantes dead.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Agence France Presse
notes: Boko Haram slit the throats of five civilians during a targeted attack against workers from the Diffa area who were working near Bosso.
Boko Haram attacks Ngamdu on the night of 10/07, some 100 kilometres (60 miles) from Maiduguri, killing 11.
Boko Haram attacks and kills 43 in the villages of Kalwa, Misala and Gwollam of Monguno LGA on 10/07.
Boko Haram attacks Buni Yadi on 10/07, kills nine.

15 people were killed, including one gendarme, and 80 injured in a suicide attack at the entrance of a central market in Ndjamena. The suicide bomber was allegedly wearing a burqa and detonated the bomb when a municipal police officer and paramilitary official stopped the bomber to search him. The attack was claimed by Boko Haram.
Boko Haram attacks and battles military forces at Ngamdu, Mainok and Jakana locations in Borno State on 11/07. "Scores" dead.
Boko Haram attacks and battles military forces at Ngamdu, Mainok and Jakana locations in Borno State on 11/07. "Scores" dead.
Boko Haram attacks and battles military forces at Ngamdu, Mainok and Jakana locations in Borno State on 11/07. "Scores" dead.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Radio France Internationale; Jeune Afrique
notes: A Boko Haram suicide bomb attack killed 15 and wounded at least 74 others near the central market in NDjamena.
Boko Haram suicide bombers target the Borno Express Terminus Motor Park, Maiduguri, killing two passer-by and injuring three others. The number of bombers killed in the explosion are not known.

Twin suicide blasts killed at least 13 and injured 17 others, many of them soldiers, at a bar in the border town of Fotokol. The bombers were dressed in burqas and struck as locals were breaking their Ramadan fast. Of the 13 killed (all reportedly during the first blast at the bar), 1 was a Chadian soldier, while of those wounded at least 4 were Chadian soldiers and 3 were Cameroonian soldiers. Most of the soldiers were wounded in the second attack which hit as soldiers from a nearby special forces camp approached the bar after the first blast, although other reports say the second bomber headed straight for the military camp and there was a gunfight before the detonation. The attack were claimed by Boko Haram.

Twin suicide blasts killed at least 13 and injured 17 others, many of them soldiers, at a bar in the border town of Fotokol. The bombers were dressed in burqas and struck as locals were breaking their Ramadan fast. Of the 13 killed (all reportedly during the first blast at the bar), 1 was a Chadian soldier, while of those wounded at least 4 were Chadian soldiers and 3 were Cameroonian soldiers. Most of the soldiers were wounded in the second attack which hit as soldiers from a nearby special forces camp approached the bar after the first blast, although other reports say the second bomber headed straight for the military camp and there was a gunfight before the detonation. The attack were claimed by Boko Haram.

3 Boko Haram fighters and 1 officer of the Nigerien national guard were killed in an attack on the civilian prison in Diffa. The officer was killed when one of the attackers detonated an explosive belt, while another guard was injured.

Boko Haram fighters attacked Tetewa Island on Lake Chad, near the border with Nigeria. Chad army reported 117 Boko Haram militants killed and 2 soldiers killed in clashes the last two weeks of July in the Lakes region (30 fatalities coded for July 13 clashes in Bol, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Medi Koura, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Blarigi, and 29 coded for July 27 clashes in Telia).
Boko Haram attacks Mainuk on 13/07, thirty causalities.
Four people killed were killed on 13/07 when a suicide bomber hit a military checkpoint on the outskirts of the north-eastern Nigerian city of Maiduguri.

A suspected Boko Haram militant was killed during an attack on a Cameroonian military post in the locality of Ldaoutsas (lat/longs not available) in the Far North region. A civilian was also wounded in the attack.
Eleven (some sources claim 20) are dead following a clash between Boko Haram and military forces in Warsala, Ngamdu on 14/07.

source: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
notes: The Nigerien army claims to have killed at least 30 Boko Haram members between July.15-17. In one encounter, 10 militants were killed while an 2 people were captured, including an important emir.

48 hours after Boko Haram attacked Mainok, which left 30 persons dead and most part of the village burnt, Boko Haram on 15/07 returned to attack village for a second time in a week, killing an additional 15.

source: Xinhua News Agency - French; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: As many as 10 residents of Gamgara, in the Bosso area, were killed in an attack by Boko Haram, while several others were seriously injured.
Boko Haram attacks Damasak on 15/07, twelve causalities.
Boko Haram attacked Hambagtha and Limankara in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno State on 16/07 killing "scores" of people and destroying houses.

source: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
notes: The Nigerien army claims to have killed at least 30 Boko Haram members between July.15-17. In one encounter, 10 militants were killed while an 2 people were captured, including an important emir.
Twin suspected Boko Haram suicide blasts strike a Gombe bus station, 49 dead, 71 injured. Boko Haram suspected.
Boko Haram attacked Hambagtha and Limankara in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno State on 16/07 killing "scores" of people and destroying houses.
Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari on 17/07, killing 10.
1 villager was killed and 3 others injured in a suspected Boko Haram raid on Midi on the banks of Lake Chad.
19 Boko Haram fighters and 1 Chadian soldier were killed in an attack on a military position in Konguia (lat/longs not available).

source: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
notes: The Nigerien army claims to have killed at least 30 Boko Haram members between July.15-17. In one encounter, 10 militants were killed while an 2 people were captured, including an important emir.
Three police and five members of Boko Haram are dead after the latter carried out a bomb attack on a police outpost in Damaturu.
More than 20 civilians were killed when more than 80 suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked the village of Kamouna near Lake Chad. 7 soldiers were present but they were overwhelmed by the attackers.
More than 20 people were killed when more than 80 suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked the village of Kamouna near Lake Chad. 7 soldiers were present but they were overwhelmed by the attackers.
At least 20 people were killed, including the perpetrators, after 2 allegedly female suicide bombers blew themselves up in a busy marketplace in Maroua. At least 32 people were wounded.
Suspected Boko Haram attack Pompommari, kill eight. Date disputed, either 22/07 or 23/07.
Twin bomb blasts at bus stations in Gombe kill 29, plus many injuries. Boko Haram suspected.
Military forces retake Dikwa following a heavy bombardment. Causalities not known. It was later revealed military forces were able to release 30 Boko Haram hostages.
Boko Haram attacks a village in Madagali LGA killing 25
Boko Haram attacks Maikadiri, Askira/Uba LGA during the morning hours 15 dead

Clashes between military and Boko Haram in Medi Koura, during a search operation for Boko Haram hiding on the lakes islands. At time of fighting, reported that 6 Boko Haram killed, 15 wounded. One soldier killed. Later, Chad army reported 117 Boko Haram militants killed and 2 soldiers killed in clashes the last two weeks of July in the Lakes region (30 fatalities coded for July 13 clashes in Bol, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Medi Koura, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Blarigi, and 29 coded for July 27 clashes in Telia). In Medi Koura, Boko Haram reported to have kidnapped women and children.

Clashes between military and Boko Haram in Blarigi Island on Lake Chad. Chad army reported 117 Boko Haram militants killed and 2 soldiers killed in clashes the last two weeks of July in the Lakes region (30 fatalities coded for July 13 clashes in Bol, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Medi Koura, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Blarigi, and 29 coded for July 27 clashes in Telia).

source: Associated Press International; Radio France Internationale; Xinhua
notes: A suicide bomber attacked a popular night spot in the Pont Vert neighbourhood of Maroua, killing at least 21 civilians and injuring 67.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber targets a Damaturu market, 15 reported dead, 50 injured. It is believed the bomber was a "mentally handicapped female."
Boko Haram behead 3 people in Tchebe-Tchebe, and set fire to land.

source: Agence France Presse; LOeil du Sahel; Xinhua
notes: Boko Haram set fire to police and military facilities in Afade, killing one. Reports differ on whether the person killed was a gendarme or an inmate. 3 other inmates died in the fires. 4 soldiers and 3 policeman reportedly missing.

Clashes between military and Boko Haram 20kms south of Baga Sola, Lake Chad. Boko Haram reportedly abducted an unknown number of soldiers. Chad army reported 117 Boko Haram militants killed and 2 soldiers killed in clashes the last two weeks of July in the Lakes region (30 fatalities coded for July 13 clashes in Bol, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Medi Koura, 30 coded for July 25 clashes in Blarigi, and 29 coded for July 27 clashes in Telia).
Boko Haram attacks Dille, military forces retaliate, killing 11 of the attackers. Civilian casualties reported, though exact numbers are not known.

Boko Haram attacks Buratai during the evening hours but are repelled by military forces. Causalities not known. Boko Haram regrouped and made a second pass at the town the following morning, but are equally repelled by military forces. Causalities unknown from the second attack.

Boko Haram slit the throats of 10 fishermen in villages (Bundaram, where they killed four people, Fishdam, where they killed two people, and Kwatar Mali, remainder) near Baga on the shores of the Lake Chad.
Boko Haram attacks of Mwuthamam (near Dille) on 27/07, casualties reported, tough numbers are not known.

Boko Haram attacks Buratai during the evening hours but are repelled by military forces. Causalities not known. Boko Haram regrouped and made a second pass at the town the following morning, but are equally repelled by military forces. Causalities unknown from the second attack.
A Boko Haram suicide attack kills eight in Maiduguris Gamboru market.
Ten are dead after Boko Haram attacks Kukuwa-Gari village of Gujba on 31/07.

Military forces carry out a series of air attacks on Boko Haram positions in Bita (Bida), Borno State. A "large number" of causalities. The strikes were in response to a Boko Haram planned offensive on the village, for which they were mobilising.
Boko Haram attacks Kolbachuwa location in Madagali LGA, killing between five and eight on 02/08.
Boko Haram and military forces battle in Bama LGA, 13 killed and 27 wounded. Additionally, military forces freed 178 hostages being held by Boko Haram, and arrested a prominent commander.
Seven are killed in a Boko Haram attack on four Konduga LGA, including Malari.
Boko Haram kills nine fishermen at Baga village on 04/08.

source: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse - English; Radio France Internationale
notes: Boko Haram attacked the villages of Tchakarmari and Kangaleri (geo coordinates not available) in the North. They burned houses, killed at least 8 (fatalities spread over two locations), and kidnapped up to 145 civilians.
In a battle between Boko Haram and the Chadian military near Tchoukou Telia on Lake Chad, 7 Islamists were killed and 2 soldiers were injured.
Boko Haram attacks Tadagara and Dumbulwa villages in Yobe State, killing nine residents.
Boko Haram attacks Tadagara and Dumbulwa villages in Yobe State, killing nine residents.
Boko Haram abducts six and kills four in Nwajurko village in Damboa local government area of Borno State.

source: Associated Press International; Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse - English
notes: Hundreds of Boko Haram fighters attacked Ashigashiya and Cameroonian troops responded, leaving 10 militants and 1 soldier dead and 2 soldiers injured. Some arrests were also made.
Boko Haram attacks Bale Mamman near Maiduguri on 11/08. Six killed, four abducted.
Boko Haram targets a market in Sabon Gari, killing 47 and injuring dozens in a large explosion.
Seventeen members of Boko Haram were killed on the evening of 12/08 by local youth militia group in Lahou village (Askira/Uba), Borno state.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Blame, torching homes and killing 8 civilians and 2 soldiers.

Boko Haram attacks Kukuwa Tasha village, Gujba local government area of Yobe state on 13/08, battles military forces. Initial reports claim four members of Boko Haram, one civilian dead, though some witnesses claim eight were shot. Later reports from witnesses claim the attack and subsequent fighting was on intense the civilian population fled, 150+ drowning in a nearby river - Boko Haram may have facilitated the drowning. Further, one witness claims Boko Haram, upon entering the village, indiscriminately began opening fire on the villagers. The military, however, disputes these claims, though have confirmed a Boko Haram commander was killed in the fighting.

Boko Haram reportedly killings the inhabitants of a remote village in Gujba LGA. Residents report as much as 150 dead after Boko Haram fired upon civilians and chased them into a lake. Local authorities say that as many as 50 may have died while the mil
A Boko Haram suicide attack on a market in Rumurigo village of Askira/Uba LGA kills the attacker and injures a security official.
Nigerian air forces launch an air raid on Boko Haram locations in Sambisa Forest. Causalities not known.
Boko Haram raided the village of Awonori, a farming and herding village near the fishing town of Damasak, killed seven residents, carting away food supplies and livestock.
Following a aerial bombardment on Boko Haram positions in Sambisa, the fleeing militants were engaged by soldiers at Gwoza. Military forces recovered weapons, and killed "many" members of the sect.

Nigerian Air Forces launch an aerial bombardment of Sambisa Forest for the second time in a week. Military forces report the deaths "of a number of them." Other Boko Haram equipment was also reported destroyed. A military patrol engaged at Gwoza the militants as they fled.
Military forces dislodge Boko Haram from Gudumbali on 21/08, killing "many" enemy fighters. Two soldiers reported dead.
Two Nigerian soldiers died during an advance through Dikwa when they stepped on a land mine buried by Boko Haram.
Two suspected Boko Haram members blew themselves up on Lake Chad while being pursued by the Chadian military.
Boko Haram attacks Marfunudi in Damboa LGA on 25/08, kills 24 people.
Seven dead (including the bomber) and many others injured when a child bomber with suspected links to Boko Haram targeted a Damaturu bus station on 25/08. Some sources report a twin blast.

Suspected Boko Haram attacks at a military check-point in Maiduguri with a pair of suicide blasts, causing the death of an Air Force officer and a civilian, four total. Conflicting report - Vanguard reports the attack occurred the evening of 25/08.
Boko Haram attacks Kafa on 27/08, killing four people.
Mounted on horseback, Boko Haram attacks Baanu village, Nganzai LGA. Differing reports put the fatalities at 56 and 68.
Boko Haram attacks Karnuwa, Nganzai on 29/08, killing four, including the chief imam of the village.
Boko Haram attacks Hambagda, Nganzai on 30/08, killing seven and injuring five others.
Boko Haram killed "dozens" in an attack on Fatawe village near Gwoza on 31/08. The attackers arrived on horseback.
Military forces retake Gambaru, Ngala on 01/09. The source alludes to a battle. Causalities not known.

Mounted on horseback, Boko Haram attacked Kolori and its neighbouring village Baana-imam, both of Damboa LGA late in the day of 01/09. Between twenty-four and twenty-six reported dead between the two villages, though the majority of deaths (18) occurred in Kolori.
At least five civilians have been killed and four others injured from a Boko Haram attack on Mainari (Mairami).
Boko Haram attacks Kirawa, killing 53 and injuring many others.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a market in Askira, 30 dead. Date not known - source dated 05/09.
The army pushed back an attack by Boko Haram, killing at least three.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Radio France Internationale
notes: At least 9 were killed and 14 injured in twin suicide attacks by two teenage boys likely linked to Boko Haram. The attacks took place in the Latin Quarter and the main market of Kolofata.
Boko Haram ambushed soldiers on patrol in Dabanga, killing two and burning two vehicles.
About 9 civilians were killed by suspected Boko Haram assailants who also burned several houses.
Boko Haram attacks two passenger busses on 18/09 near Mainuk, killing "scores."

Two Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate 200 meters from each other in the market in Mora. Civilians were targeted. 5 killed, including an off-duty policeman, two civilians, and the two suicide bombers. 29 wounded.
A series of four suspected Boko Haram suicide bomb blasts on 20/09 causes 117 deaths (as counted over several days) and numerous injuries in Maiduguri.
Clashes between military and Boko Haram in Amchide. 2 Boko Haram killed on Sept 21.
2 women suicide bombers of Boko Haram killed themselves and injured two farmers.
Clashes between military and Boko Haram in Amchide for second day. 15 Boko Haram killed on Sept 22.
Military forces overrun the Boko Haram areas Janguoriri and Bulatori, rescuing 241 women and children and capturing a top commander (Bulama Modu) and 42 others. Casualties not known.
Military forces overrun the Boko Haram areas Janguoriri and Bulatori, rescuing 241 women and children and capturing a top commander (Bulama Modu) and 42 others. Casualties not known.
Military forces capture Bamki from Boko Haram, several militants (numbers not known) were killed and several others captured alive.
Boko Haram attacks the Madagali communities of Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse over three days, leaving scores dead and 50 houses destroyed.
Boko Haram cross from Nigeria into Komadougou Yobe and kill 15 civilians.
Boko Haram attacks the Madagali communities of Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse over three days, leaving scores dead and 50 houses destroyed.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: Boko Haram killed 8 and kidnapped a young girl in an attack on a village in the Tika area. Over 100 houses were burned along with at least one vehicle, and several were injured.
Boko Haram attacks the Madagali communities of Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse over three days, leaving scores dead and 50 houses destroyed.
Boko Haram attacks Mailari village in Konduga Local Government Area (LGA) of Borno killing between 9 and 20 and destroying several homes.
Military forces attack a Boko Haram group in the Kwatarha and Torikwaptir general area of Gwoza, killing a wanted leader and injuring others, all of whom escaped.
Four are dead in a Boko Haram attack on Bitiku and Kubu, Hong LGA.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: In retaliation for arrests in Bodo, Boko Haram attacked the nearby village of Mafoufou, burning most of the homes.
Four are dead in a Boko Haram attack on Bitiku and Kubu, Hong LGA.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: Over 10 Boko Haram attacked the village of Siguel, near Bodo, setting it on fire. No report of casualties.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: After Boko Haram attacked the village of Siguel, they headed towards Bodo where a vigilante militia fought back and captured 5 militants.
At least seven explosions detonate in Maiduguri on 01/10, killing a "number" of people. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrator. The army later confirmed 14 dead, 39 injured.
On their way to protect the village of Baroua, troops were ambushed by Boko Haram who killed 2 and wounded 7.
Seven are dead in a Boko Haram attack on Kirsinga.
A pair of Boko Haram suspected suicide bombers target Kuje and nearby Nyanya, both in suburban Abuja. At least 18 dead and 41 wounded. Boko Haram officially claimed responsibility over the next days.
A pair of Boko Haram suspected suicide bombers target Kuje and nearby Nyanya, both in suburban Abuja. At least 18 dead and 41 wounded. Boko Haram officially claimed responsibility over the next days.

source: Associated Press International; Vanguard website; Agence France Presse
notes: At least one suicide bombing took place, perhaps two, when police confronted suspected members of Boko Haram, who then detonated explosives. A policeman, 4 militants, and at least 5 civilians died.

source: Deutsche Welle; Agence France Presse - English
notes: Boko Haram carried out a pre-dawn strike near Lake Chad, killing 11 soldiers and wounding several. 17 Boko Haram militants also died in the clashes.
A series of multiple, coordinated attacks during the morning hours in Damaturu, 18 dead. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrators.
Boko Haram attacks Geidam town, shooting sporadically. Causalities not known.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen launched rockets at two commercial trucks near Dabanga, injuring at least one.
Following their attack on Geidam, Boko Haram forces encounter military forces at nearby Ngollom village. Ten Boko Haram dead and others wounded.
100 Boko Haram fighters are gunned down when they attempted to attack a military position in Goniri. Weapons were recovered as well. Seven soldiers also killed.
Two suicide bombers suspected to be members of Boko Haram detonated explosives in a mosque in Gubio town of Borno State, killing a dozen worshippers during an early morning prayer session.
Eighteen dead and other injuries reported following a pair of suicide bomb blasts in Abuja. Boko Haram suspected.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Suicide bombers, including 3 women and 2 children likely affiliated with Boko Haram, attacked a fish market and IDP camps, killing 47 and injuring dozens.
Boko Haram attacks Balakari on 10/10, a village in Chibok Local Government Area, killing four and burning houses.

source: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse - English
notes: Twin suicide bombings by young women likely affiliated with Boko Haram killed at least 9 and wounded dozens in the town of Kangeleri, near Mora.

Multiple bomb blasts reported in Maiduguri on 13/10, later determined to be suicide blasts. The explosives occurred at three minutes intervals and seven people were confirmed dead, including the three suicide [Boko Haram], while 11 others sustained various degrees of injuries.
Boko Haram launched a series of suicide attacks outside of Maiduguri in Gumsuri beginning the evening of 15/10, continuing into 16/10 in Maiduguri proper. 37 dead over the two days.
Insurgents conducted a raid and opened fire in the city, killing two civilians as they fled.

"Scores" dead after suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attacked three targets at Tudun Natsira and one at Banakwai all in Ajilari area of Gommari in Maiduguri. The targets were believed to be mosques - the attackers were disguised as worshippers. Death totals reached 37 over the two days of attacks.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: Boko Haram ambushed a military vehicle, killing an officer from the Rapid Intervention Force and injuring three other soldiers.
Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Dar village, Madagali LGA on 17/10 of Madagali, kill 12 residents.
A suicide bomber from suspected Boko Haram was shot dead by security forces during an attempt to bomb the headquarters of 7 Division of the Nigeria Army in Maiduguri.

Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram members, killing 30 after a gun battle. Three soldiers abducted. Location a matter of dispute - the article lead describes the action in Borno, though the text of the article claims the event occurred in villages of Kirchinga/Imirsa of Madagali, Adamawa. The ambush may have been a response to a suicide attack in the area the previous day. Boko Haram reportedly killed 3 soldiers an abducted one senior officer while disguised a local vigilantes.

Military forces, along with a local militia group attack and kill 150 members of Boko Haram in Madagali LGA, recover weapons on 20/10. A gun battle between the two actors had occurred several days previous.

Boko Haram raided Cameroonian territory near the village of Soueram in the Far Nort. Military response led to "heavy fighting". Coordinates are approximate based on Soueram's location 17 km from Fotokol.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: Boko Haram ambushed military forces from the Rapid Intervention Battalion. Casualties unknown.

source: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse - English
notes: A suicide attacker killed himself and two soldiers on the outskirts of Diffa. The military killed three other would-be bombers at the scene.
Military responded to a Boko Haram raid on the town of Doulo, engaging in a gun battle with the militants. Casualties unknown.
Boko Haram attacked Ashigashiya. Military response led to violent clashes.
Boko Haram raided the village of Doulo, killing 8 and injuring 9.
Twenty bus passengers are shot killed by Boko Haram in Jigalta.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Agence France Presse - English
notes: About 20 Boko Haram militants on motorcycles attacked Keraoua, killing at least 9 and kidnapping 20.
One day after attacking Keraoua and killing several civilians, Boko Haram "seized control of the town" as military forces were sent in for reinforcement.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a mosque in Yola on 23/10, at least 30 reported dead, many others injured.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a mosque in Maiduguri on 23/10, 28 dead, plus injuries.

Four suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers detonate in the Dala Yazaram neighbourhood of Maiduguri on 24/10, at least three dead, plus the bombers The attack comes a day following another, larger attack in the city. Note: One of the attackers was arrested before the attack.
Boko Haram attacks Jakana on 27/10, kills eight villagers.
Boko Haram attacked the Ala village just across the border from Nigeria in the Diffa region, killing 13 and injuring 3 while burning buildings.

A total of 338 hostages held by militant group Boko Haram have been rescued by troops who raided enclaves of the rebels near the Sambisa Forest located in Nigerias northeastern state of Borno on 27/10. The rescue took place following an air strike by the countrys air forces. Causalities not reported.
Military forces capture four members of Boko Haram following an hour-long battle in Karchiga village of Madagali Local Government Area. No casualties reported.
Boko Haram conducted an incursion into the village of Gafe, abducting 6 civilians before the military could be alerted.
Military forces engage in a gun battle in Dunamari (Duwabafi) with Boko Haram, four Boko Haram dead.

Three Boko Haram died and 11 civilians were wounded as soldiers repelled an attempted suicide bombing at the Bougama military post near Bamou village on Lake Chad. Simultaneously soldiers killed 11 Boko Haram members during an attempted suicide attack on the Kaika army post. Two soldiers were also killed.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Barakesse, killing two civilians and burning around 40 homes.
A military convoy drove over a mine and then exchanged fire with Boko Haram. One soldier died.
Military forces destroy and seize a Boko Haram camp at Kerenoa Area of Monguno, Borno State on 04/11. Two reported dead, weapons recovered.
The Niger army launched airstrikes against Boko Haram near the village of Dagaya. Casualty figures unknown, while 20 Boko Haram militants were arrested.

Military forces conduct an offensive against four Boko Haram camps, overtaking all and rescuing 20 prisoners and killing "a number" of Boko Haram. The operations occurred in Bornos north-east, in Rigaga and its adjourning villages in Bama axis.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Radio France Internationale
notes: Two female suicide bombers killed themselves and at least two civilians in an attack attributed to Boko Haram on Ngouboua village. 14 were injured. Days later, the government imposed a state of emergency, limiting movement and authorizing searches.

source: LOeil du Sahel; Agence France Presse - English
notes: At least 3 civilians and 1 young female suicide bomber were killed in an attack attributed to Boko Haram. Authorities responded, shooting and killing a second bomber.
Boko Haram assassinated the son of a tribal chief.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.
Boko Haram killed five people in an incursion into Bia.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.
