Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.
The regional president of the Cameroon Peoples Democratic Movement was assassinated by Boko Haram. Authorities responded by killing around 10 assailants in the extreme north.

"At the weekend" military forces attack and gain control of a Boko Haram location at Gasarwa, which lies between Monguno and Maiduguri. The troops killed 18 Boko Haram and recovery an array of weapons.
"At the weekend" military forces attack and gain control of a Boko Haram location at Boboshe village near Durkwa, Hawul LGA, recovering weapons.
Boko Haram attacks military forces at Kardewa, Borno State, "as the weekend" but are repelled. Causalities not known.

"At the weekend" military forces attack Boko Haram stronghold, overtaking the Borno State areas of Gubumbali, Kardewa, Anguwan Fulani Rogo, Anguwan Fulani Kaderwa, Dure Fadagwe Christian, Fdacwe Muni and Balazala, recovering weapons. 19 dead in total, divided among two events. The operation was in coordination with operation in Azare and Monguno.

"At the weekend" military forces attack Boko Haram stronghold, overtaking the Borno State areas of Gubumbali, Kardewa, Anguwan Fulani Rogo, Anguwan Fulani Kaderwa, Dure Fadagwe Christian, Fdacwe Muni and Balazala, recovering weapons. 19 dead in total, divided among two events. The operation was in coordination with operation in Azare and Monguno.
Boko Haram attacked two large trucks, burning one and taking the other with the driver and his assistant on board.
5 Boko Haram killed in firefight with Cameroonian army
Army launched ground and air assault against Boko Haram, capturing 19.
Suspected Boko Haram detonates explosives in a suicide attack in Yola the evening of 17/11, killing 34 and injured 80. Numbers vary by source.

Nigerian Army supported by Nigeria Air force aircraft, have killed about 40 Boko Haram members and destroyed their rocket fabrication factory after carrying out several raids and attacks on Boko Haram camps in Matali, Damboa Local Government Area of Borno State.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate explosives in Tarauni, Kano on 18/11. Nineteen dead, 53 injured. Numbers vary by source. The attackers were believed to be female.
Boko Haram and military forces clash in Gudunbali on 18/11, two officers and 105 soldiers reported missing. Military officials later dispute the missing soldier claim.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Gambaru. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Mada. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Kumshe. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Karetu. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Banki. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Suspected Boko Haram members on 20/11 night launched an attack on Kwanti village in Fika local government area of Yobe State, in which 7 persons were killed.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Radio France Internationale
notes: Four teenage girls associated with Boko Haram blew themselves up, killing a traditional chief and four of his family members.

A young girl carrying a suicide pack detonates near a military checkpoint, killing herself and seven passengers of a bus who had disembarked to be searched. It is believed the bomber is affiliated with Boko Haram.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Gogone, killing 18 including the local imam, and burning 70 houses; villagers fought back with bows and arrows. 11 were injured and a child disappeared.
Boko Haram killed one and wounded two, burning buildings in a village near Fotokol.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
source: Radio France Internationale; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Military forces carried out "mopping up exercises" against Boko Haram over three days in the Mayo-Sava area of extreme north region, killing around 100 militants and releasing hundreds of their hostages.
Boko Haram attacked a suburb of Fotokol, killing one and burning buildings.

Twenty-two are dead following a Boko Haram suicide bombing on a procession of a Shiite group in Garum Mallam, Dakasoye, south of Kano. Shortly after the attack Boko Haram made a statement, claiming responsibility.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
source: Radio France Internationale; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Military forces carried out "mopping up exercises" against Boko Haram over three days in the Mayo-Sava area of extreme north region, killing around 100 militants and releasing hundreds of their hostages.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
source: Radio France Internationale; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Military forces carried out "mopping up exercises" against Boko Haram over three days in the Mayo-Sava area of extreme north region, killing around 100 militants and releasing hundreds of their hostages.

source: Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service; Radio France Internationale; Cameroon POSTline
notes: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers killed themselves and 5 civilians, injuring at least one soldier near the Dabanga military base.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Gouzoudou, killing at least five and burning around a dozen houses.

Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Gulak following an attack on a military base by the latter. Twenty members of Boko Haram, and at least one soldier dead plus 100+ missing. During the battle Boko Haram temporarily dislodged the solders and came to posses their weapons.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Nigerian Tribune
notes: Boko Haram killed four, injured two, and burned about 50 homes in a cross-border raid.
Boko Haram attacks Gajiganna village in Magumeri LGA on 29/11, killing three villagers and a soldier before carting away a lot of foodstuff into an awaiting pickup van.
Boko Haram attacks Bam village of Biu LGA during the morning hours of 30/11, killing four, abducting several girls and destroying the town.
Two soldiers killed by a land mine.
After two suicide bombers attacked civilians in Waza, a third potential bomber was shot and killed by soldiers.

source: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press; Cameroon POSTline
notes: At least two suicide bombers detonated in Waza, killing at least six people including themselves.
Armed men suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Gamgara, a farming community in Abadan(m) area of Borno State, killed six men and injured several others in an attack around 8.30pm on 01/12.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber kills herself and three others in Sabon Gari.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber kills herself and two others at a market in Klimba.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press; Deutsche Welle; Radio France Internationale; Medecins Sans Frontieres
notes: Three or four suicide attacks at markets on Loulou Fou or Koulfoua island killed at least 27 people including the attackers and injured more than 80.
Boko Haram attacks Takulashi, Chibok LGA on 06/12, attacking residents and destroying 60 houses. "Scores injured."
Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram at Pulka, kill 100+. The fighters had been fleeing a military "onslaught" in Sambisa Forest, no causality exact figures provided from the original clash.
Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram at Pulka, kill 100+. The fighters had been fleeing a military "onslaught" in Sambisa Forest, no causality exact figures provided from the original clash.
Military forces deliver a "decisive blow" to Boko Haram at Buni Yadi, recovering a large amount of weapons. No causalities reported.
Military forces clash with Boko Haram Furkati village, Geidam Local Government Area. Five Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered.

Boko Haram attacks Buratai on 18/12 during the early morning hours, sparking a clash with military forces. Fourteen causalities. The town is home to the army chief, leading the military to believe the attack was a response to strategic gains in recent months. On 10/12, Boko Haram attacked nearby Kamuya, which is home to the officers mother.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Eight civilians and one suicide bomber were killed in an attack by Boko Haram. 22 injured
Four are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Mangari on 12/12.
Six are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Mangari on 12/12.
Twenty villagers are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Warawara (Biu LGA) on 12/12.

source: Cameroon Tribune; Xinhua General News Service
notes: A vigilante group discovered a group of female suicide bombers trying to get access to a mosque and alerted the authorities. A vigilante hit one bomber with an arrow and then she detonated her explosive. Security forces killed another bomber without detonation.
Boko Haram ambushes a military convoy along Maiduguri-Bama road, killing a lieutenant colonel.

During the week between 12/12 - 18/18 (date not known) military forces battle Boko Haram along the "Alagarno axis," killing fifteen and rescuing hostages. The confrontation was part of a larger operation in the area.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: One "civilian vigilante" and four Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following an attack on a checkpoint in Mafa.
A child suicide bomber detonated his explosives, killing himself, two other bombers and six people on the morning of 20/12 in Benisheikh. The bombers were in their mid-teens.
Nigerian troops have killed three Boko Haram fighters and recovered a cache of arms and ammunition following a battle near Damboa in Borno state. Among the dead include a leader known as "Ameer."
Nigerian forces encounter Boko Haram at Mainari (Mafa LGA), killing nine members of the sect and recovering weapons.
At least 2 soldiers and 3 civilians were killed and others injured when Boko Haram attacked the village of Abadam.
Four suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers kill 14, including themselves, while injuring 39 others. The attack took place in the Sager area of the city on the evening of 24/12.
Boko Haram attacks Kimba village the evening of 25/12, killing between 13 and 16, abducting or injuring others and burning houses. The source reported Boko Haram had "taken control of the village."
A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed herself and injured two civilians with a bomb in the village of Tolkomari in the far north.

Nigerian forces shoot and kill seven potential suicide bombers (some reports claim 14) attempting to gain access to Maiduguri (at Aladuwari area) on 27/12. [A] Major General of the 7 Division said the militants intended to carry out massive and coordinated suicide mission through Asmari, Damboa check point, Ali Dawari, Molai Kura, Baderi, Jumari villages, all at the outskirts of Maiduguri. This follows the detonation by three of bombers at a nearby mosque, killing 25 and injuring 85. The bombers were reported to be teen-aged girls.

A pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate themselves near a petrol station in Isari, killing 19. It is believed the attack was in coordination with an attack on Maiduguri, 130km to the west. It was noted the attackers were female.

Nigerian forces shoot and kill seven potential suicide bombers (some reports claim 14) attempting to gain access to Maiduguri (at Aladuwari area) on 27/12 This follows the detonation by three of bombers at a nearby mosque, killing 25 and injuring 85. The bombers were reported to be teen-aged girls.

source: Xinhua General News Service; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers killed themselves and injured one other; they detonated their explosives as they ran away from villagers who foiled their plan to attack civilians.

Boko Haram conduct a additional suicide attacks on a Maiduguri mosque in Sulemanti ward, a day following a series of attacks on the town. Twenty reported dead, though accounts vary, some numbering the dead as high as 40.
Suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a Madagali motor park on 28/12, killing between 30 and 50 and injuring many others. The attack occurred at 9am.
Two Boko Haram suicice bombers detonated explosives outside a mosque, killing themselves and injuring 27.
On 2 January, gunshots were heard after a Boko-Haram incursion in Mozogo. 2 dead.
A vigilante group chased away a Boko Haram suicide bomber, who then detonated, killing only herself.
an attack by Boko Haram against the village of Ouro-Mari in the Makary Subdivision is foiled by a military response.
Boko Haram ambushed a vehicle transporting the Special Commissioner to Dabanga and the local chief of police, Ismaila Sago, kidnapping them. Two civilians dead.
On 4 January, the FMM attacked BH elements who infiltrated Walashi refugees in Malashi, Mayo Sava. One dead.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates a pack at Izge Gwoza and Izge Dambuwa in Gwoza Local Government area of Borno State at the border of Adamawa State, killing 26.
On 5 January, BH elements attacked Oulou Msao, Logone et Chari. One killed and 70 houses burned.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Military forces reported they have rescued 3,212 trapped civilians following a firelight in Dikwa with Boko Haram on 07/01. Causalities not known.
Boko Haram incursion; one farmer killed, two women kidnapped.
Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and injured three in a mosque in Danke village near Kolofata.
Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and two others in front of a mosque.
Boko Haram gunmen attacked the village of Goura Tembe in the Makari area, killing one and injuring one and burning part of the town.
Boko Haram gunmen have killed seven people and injured others in a raid on "some (unnamed) villages" in Madagali LGA during the early morning hours of 10/01.
On 11 January, a kamikaze died when his charge exploded in Talkomari, Mayo Sava.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Cameroon Tribune
notes: Two were killed overnight in the Kolofata area by Boko Haram. Troops responded and attackers fled.
Defence Forces pushed back an attack by Boko Haram in the Kolofata Sub-division, killing two assailants.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Radio France Internationale; Cameroon Tribune
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and 12 civilians at a mosque in Kouyape, also known as Gaboua, just south of Kolofata.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Churokusko village in Tarmowa (Tarmua) local government area at the mid-morning of 15/01. Military Forces killed "many" of their attackers.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Goniri army base during the early morning hours of 15/01, killing 17 of the attackers. One soldier was reported injured.
At least six soldiers were killed and five wounded when their vehicle hit an explosive device likely planted by Boko Haram.
6 Nigerien soldiers killed by mine laid by Boko Haram

source: Cameroon Tribune; Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
notes: Suicide bomber detonated in mosque, killing himself and 4 others and injuring 2. A vigiliante group prevented more deaths by alerting worshippers just before the explosion.

Nigerian troops on 20/01 repelled an evening Boko Haram attack on Buratai town, killing some of the insurgents. At least three of the insurgents were killed and many of them escaped with bullet wounds.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Nigerian forces stationed in Dikwa repel a Boko Haram attack on the town. No reported causalities. Date not known - source dated 21/01.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Soldier killed by a mine likely planted by Boko Haram.
On 22 January, Cameroonian militaries ambushed Boko Haram men in Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava. One dead.

Three Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in an attempt to attack Nigerian forces at a Maiduguri checkpoint. One of the attackers were shot by a soldier before he was able to detonate himself. No other causalities.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Kuwiya (Kudiye), 10 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ruga Fulani, 8 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Boko Haram attack left three dead, including a member of a vigilante militia.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Mijigine (Mijigete), 10 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Marte, 21 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ajigin, three reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Five are killed "early this week" (source date 28/01) when Boko Haram attacked traders in Jawu, near Auno.

source: Radio France Internationale; Associated Press International
notes: Four Boko Haram suicide bombers attacked a market, killing 37 and injuring 81.
Boko Haram attacked and killed a civilian, destroying his house in Babban Gida village.
On 26 January, a double suicide attack in Kerawa, Mayo Sava, resulted in the injury of 19 people.

Two suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers attacked Chibok Market in Chibok Local Government area of Borno State on 27/01, leaving 14 persons dead and over 24 others seriously injured. Another bomber struck a military checkpoint in the town, injuring two.
Military "pushed back" an incursion by Boko Haram, unknown number of deaths reported and at least three civilians wounded.

source: Radio France Internationale; LOeil du Sahel; Agence France Presse English
notes: Boko Haram suicide attack on a school killed at least six, including the two attackers, and injured about a dozen more. Vigilante militia arrested two others before they could detonate.

Two suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers attacked Chibok Market in Chibok Local Government area of Borno State on 27/01, leaving 14 persons dead and over 24 others seriously injured. Another bomber struck a military checkpoint in the town, injuring two and killing only herself.
A suspected Boko Haram child suicide bomber detonated his explosive in a grain market in Gombi on 29/01, killing at least 10 people.
On 29 January, a woman kamikaze exploded herself in Talkomari, Mayo Sava, killing only herself.
At least six - including one soldier and the two attackers - were killed in a suicide attack.
On 29 January, a military truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram militants in the area of Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava. 12 people wounded.
On 29 January, a suicide attack killed three people un Bargaram, Logone et Chari.
Nigerian forces clash with suspected members of Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 30/01. No reported casualties.

Boko Haram attacks Dalori village on 30/01 killing many. Many of the dead were children who had been burnt alive. The attack occurred during the evening hours. The death toll was raised to 101 over the course of the week (The Guardian).

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: At least five members of the Civilian Joint Task Force were killed while four others sustained critical injuries when a Toyota Hilux patrol vehicle rammed into landmines/ Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) in Buma, Kaga LGA suspected to have been planted by members of Boko Haram.
Vigilantes tried to arrest a suspected member of Boko Haram, which detonated an explosive, killing himself and the three vigilantes. Local imam nearby also wounded.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Madakar, killing 3.

source: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber attacked a mosque in the village of Miterine on Lake Chad, killing himself and two others and wounding 24.

source: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse
notes: Boko Haram suicide bomber tried to attack a market at Guie on Lake Chad, but was stopped by vigilantes. The bomber detonated, killing a vigilante and himself and wounding over 30.

Military forces kill 100 members of Boko Haram and rescue 1,200 of their captives following a gun battle in Boboshe village, Dikwa LGA on 01/02. The prisoners were being held at the nearby towns of Garindawaji and Mamawarhi. Later accounts vary - This Day reports the death of 56 and the liberation of 520, other sources vary.
Military killed 15 Boko Haram militants and captured 2.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Six people were reportedly killed while one person sustained gunshot injury when suspected members of Boko Haram sect invaded Goniambari village in Kaga Local Government Area of Borno state.
Boko Haram raided two villages, Mairi and Malari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno, killing four persons and razing houses in the communities.
At least 10 persons were confirmed dead with scores injured when a group of Boko Haram invaded Mairi Mmumbe village, near Dalori of Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State.
On 8 February, Boko Haram elements killed a person and injured another during an incursion in Shahat, Logone et Chari.
Boko Haram attacked a group of firewood traders in Jawu village, about 8 kilometres from Auno town of Kondiga, west of Maiduguri, killing five.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
On 9 February, Boko Haram elements killed 3 people during an incursion in Gore Moussa, Logone et Chari.
Two female suicide bombers detonated bombs at the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Dikwa, Borno State, leaving 58 people dead and over 78 others injured.
On 10 February, Boko Haram elements attacked Bla Dole, Logone et Chari. Causalities unknown.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers kill six and wound 50 civilians.
Boko Haram kill seven villagers and burn three churches in Tourou.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram fighters at Gwai Mainari in Mainok on 11/02. "Some" Boko Haram were killed in the attack, others injured, weapons recovered.
Cameroonian soldiers launch a cross border raid against Boko Haram at Goshi location (in or near Ashigashiya) on 11/02, killing at least 27.

Soldiers traversing Dogon Gida and New Marte stepped on an undetected Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by suspected Boko Haram. The explosion caused four injuries and damage to the vehicle. Elsewhere in the area (unknown exact location), military forces in a joint operation with Cameroonian forces killed 10 members of the group while recuing 45 female captives. The source states the "military forces advanced to Mararraba, Angwan Fada, Dale, Wizha, Bokko Timit, Bokko Nasanu, Bokko Hide, up to Ngoshe village where they linked up with the Cameroonians." However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.

Soldiers traversing Dogon Gida and New Marte stepped on an undetected Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by suspected Boko Haram. The explosion caused four injuries and damage to the vehicle. Elsewhere in the area (unknown exact location), military forces in a joint operation with Cameroonian forces killed 10 members of the group while recuing 45 female captives. The source states the "military forces advanced to Mararraba, Angwan Fada, Dale, Wizha, Bokko Timit, Bokko Nasanu, Bokko Hide, up to Ngoshe village where they linked up with the Cameroonians." However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.

Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.
On 13 February, Boko Haram elements killed 13 people during an incursion in Tombokare, Logone et Chari, looting and burning several houses.

Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.
On 14 February, a military truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram elements. Two dead and 5 wounded.

Military forces attack and recapture the "spiritual" Boko Haram stronghold of Alagarno (which includes Komala, Dole, Kumshi and Moadori), killing two and capturing two leaders, Mustapha Busuru and Usman Abubakar.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

Boko Haram attacks Kuda, setting fire to the village. In response to the attack military forces mobilized, though the Boko Haram attack retreated before the soldiers arrived. One woman reported dead from the fire.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.
Military forces attacked Boko Haram elements at Komala and Musafanari general area coming from Sambisa forest. A number of weapons were recovered. Casualties not known.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International
notes: 19 - 22 killed and 105 wounded in double suicide bombing at the Meme market.
Two suicide bombers detonated near a school, killing only themselves.
Two soldiers are killed diffusing a bomb laid by Boko Haram on the Amchide- Kumshe road.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces engage Boko Haram along the Talala-Banki-Kumshe axis, 23 Boko Haram militants were killed (The Nation), the troops destroyed 4 AK 47 rifles and captured a gun truck mounted with an Anti-Aircraft Gun (AA Gun) and 2 AK 47 rifles, as well as a 60mm mortar. The military forces also rescued 150 prisoners, who were mostly children. Three soldiers injured. Allied forces gained control of the area.
During a battle of Nigerian and Cameroonian forces in Kumshe a house with Boko Haram members caught fire in nearby Fatake, killing three members inside.

Military forces encounter and stop Boko Haram during a suspected coordinated attack on the Dikwa area. The troops recovered 26 bodies of Boko Haram, while others escaped with gunshot wounds; destroyed 3 VIED, 1 MBIED and two gun trucks. The military deaths not reported.
"Scores" are killed when an improvised explosive device seized from Boko Haram Islamists detonated at a police station in Jimeta, Yola area.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-); Kanuri Ethnic Group (Cameroon)
notes: An off-duty Kanuri police officer was assassinated, allegedly by Boko Haram
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Korohuma (Kotokuma), kill 37 members of the group. Two soldiers reported dead.
Boko Haram abduct six residents of Wawoulle village in Kolofata. The insurgents later execute four of the captors.
Three civilians are killed when their vehicle hits a landmine on the Boungour - Souardje road, near Makari.
Five killed when their vehicle hit a landmine likely placed by Boko Haram.
Boko Haram raid Kolofata for livestock resulting in a clash between the group and local vigilantes. The vigilantes managed to recover the stolen livestock.
Boko Haram abduct and kill a livestock breeder during a raid on Kolofata.
An army vehicle hits a mine laid by Boko Haram. An army captain is killed.
On 02 March, a military patrol vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Gouzda Vreket, Mayo-Moskota.
Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram near the Sabsawa axis of Sambisa forest. The following clash caused at least one soldier to be injured.
Military forces clear three Boko Haram camps in Alagarno forest on 04/03 (at Biu LGA) at Lawin Meleri, Matiri Bulaka and Aljeri, killing 5 members of the sect and rescuing 63 of their prisoners.
Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Dure area on 05/03. "Several" Boko Haram fatalities, three soldiers injured.
Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Amdaga Makaranta and Amdaga Madachi in Gwoza. The same brigade had recently cleared Dure. Two Boko Haram reported dead.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Dousa (Doksa) on 05/03, kill two and recovering weapons. The operation was in coordination with other military exercises in the area.
The military repels as attack by Boko Haram. No reported casualties.
Boko Haram kill a family of four during a raid for supplies.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.
A civilian is killed when Boko Haram raid the village of Emchoukouli near Fotokol.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.
On 10 March, the local militia chief was killed during an incursion of Boko Haram.
Military forces engage Boko Haram in Daba Magagi (Daban-Masara), wound and capture a prominent leader of the group.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Alajeri, Guzamala LGA, killing 40 and recovering weapons on 10/03.
On 11 March, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Gouzda Vreket, Mayo-Moskota.
On 11 March, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Gouzda Vreket, Mayo-Moskota.
On 11 March, two woman kamikaze exploded themselves in Homaka's market, Mayo Sava, before arriving to their goal, the mosque.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram forces near Komala and Musafanari villages in Sambisa forest. Several members of Boko Haram reported wonded. The clash took place "at the weekend."

Nigerian forces "at the weekend" repulse a Boko Haram attack on Pulka. A similar Boko Haram attack had occred in Pulka on 08/03. Seventeen Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. Additionally, the forces rescued 95 hostages along the nearby Bitta-Pridang-Manawashe axis, as well as 27 who had escaped from Mayo Ali village.
Boko Haram forces ambush military forces at Banki, four Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. The ambush occurred "at the weekend."
Two suicide bombers killed themselves in an attempted attack. No other injuries reported.
On 13 March, two kamikazes exploded themselves in Talkomari, Mayo Sava, killing one vigilante.

Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gwashari village along Damboa-Bale road, killing one and capturing three others. They also recovered 1 Dane gun, AK-47 rifle magazine, 2 knives, assorted drugs and the sum of N142,000.
On 14 March, a militia's (not identified) truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram elements on the Bargaram-Abassoum axis.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation "a number" of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
Five dead following an ambush and clash between Boko Haram and an area vigilante group. Two of the dead are civilans bystanders.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation "a number" of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
27 people were killed and 35 others were injured in an early morning Boko Haram double suicide attack on a mosque at Umarari-Molai (Dolori), a village 6 kilometers from Maiduguri.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Radio France Internationale; Jeune Afrique
notes: Four suicide bombers believed to be with Boko Haram attacked a military convoy, killing themselves and one officer and injuring two others. A fifth attacker was shot before detonating.
On 19 March, 2 people were killed and two others kidnapped by BH men in Guederou, Mayo Sava.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
On 20 March, a BH attack aiming at seizing some cattle heads in Homaka, Mayo Sava, was repelled by local militia and military forces.
Military air forces carry out strikes on the Allagarno forest area of Yobe, causalities not known.
On 20 March, following an incursion of Boko Haram men in Kerawa, Mayo Sava, one of the assailants was arrested.
Military forces clear Boko Harams Dalori camp, killing 18 members (Xinhua reports 27), including a prominent leader known as the "Ameer of Dalore." Additionally, 67 of their hostages were freed.
Military forces ambush Boko Haram at Dawashi location, Borno State, kill seven.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Musari on 21/03, killing 58. One soldier reportedly lost in the battle.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Boko Haram abducts 18 women and two girls from Sabongari in Adamawa on 23/03.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. "Heavy" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. "Heavy" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. "Heavy" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Civilian JTF (in coordination with military forces) stop two potential female suicide bombers at Umulari Mulai, about six kilometres away from Maiduguri on the Maiduguri-Damboa road. One of them detonated her bomb when the Civilian JTF vigilantes on duty around the area asked 'who is there.' The second bomber scurried away and holed up nearby. But she was discovered and shot when soldiers came to the site. Her bomb was later detonated. Only the two bombers reported dead.
On 25 March, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men on the Amchide-Ganse axis. 1 dead and 8 wounded.
On 25 March, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Zamga, Mayo Sava. 4 soldiers were wounded.
On 25 March, Boko Haram elements attacked Zourou, Mayo Sava: 1 dead (the village chief) and two wounded.

Military forces clear Madube Cikin along the Bita-Madube Ciki-Njubul axis, killing four Boko Haram and rescuing 54. At least one soldier injured. Date(s) of the operation vague. Military announcement made on 28/03. Presumably, the operation took place several days earlier.
Military forces gain control of the 'spiritual power base' of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. "Several" Boko Haram killed.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Bolunga village on 28/03, kill five and capture one.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: A joint military operation among the Civilans JTF and regular army on 28/03 "[that] took place at Iza [sic] general area" yields 29 Boko Haram dead, 72 rescued civilians and the clearing of Mbollena and Shamari areas. One member of the Civilian JTF was wounded in a vehicle accident.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: A joint military operation among the Civilans JTF and regular army on 28/03 "[that] took place at Iza [sic] general area" yields 29 Boko Haram dead, 72 rescued civilians and the clearing of Mbollena and Shamari areas. One member of the Civilian JTF was wounded in a vehicle accident.
Military forces gain control of the 'spiritual power base' of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. "Several" Boko Haram killed.

Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gare village near Sambisa Forest on 28/03, killing one and rescuing 36 prisoners.
On 29 March, Boko Haram elements attacked Seradje, Mayo Sava: 1 dead (the village chief).

source: Agence France Presse - English; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Six soldiers killed and three wounded in attack by Boko Haram. "Major ground and aerial operation" launched in response.
Vigilantes killed a female suicide bomber before she could detonate.
Military forces clear Wulwuta of Boko Haram on 31/03, kill 9, rescue 21 and recover weapons. One soldier wounded.
On 31 March, the village chief of Djiala (Kossa), Mayo Sava, was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.
4 Boko Haram fighters were killed and 3 captured during a fight with Nigerien security forces. This followed an ambush of Nigerien security forces the day before in the same area.
Three children were kidnapped and later escaped.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villiages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.

Military forces also captured the villiages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.
On 4 April, Boko Haram men killed 5 civilians and wounded much more during an incursion to Sandawadjiri, Mayo Sava.
Mine explosion reported involving Boko Haram on the road between Ngaroua and Garin Dogo; casualties unknown.
On 5 April, Cameroonian and Nigerian forces launched a combined attack against Boko Haram in Madaoueha, Logone et Chari. One soldier died and 8 were wounded.
Double suicide bombing by Boko Haram killed at least 3 civilians and injured several, likely near Ngaroua village.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Military forces along with the Civilian JTF intercept and repel five female Boko Haram suicide bombers attempting to enter Maiduguri at Polo and Giwa Barrack areas. Three soldiers were injured in the battle. All five of the attackers were reported dead. The clash occurred before day break.
On 8 April, an attack by Boko Haram men to the military post in Talkomari was repelled.
Three vigilantes, one civilian, and two militants killed in Boko Haram attack. Huts burned.
Attack or clash reported involving Boko Haram; casualties unknown.

Military forces, along with those from Cameroon, carry out a two day operation against Boko Haram at Madawaya Forest (7km from Cameroon's northern border, killing 58 and capturing a prominent leader. A number of hostages were also rescued in the operation.

4 people were killed by Boko Haram in Gambarou, near Double, during the week starting on August 15th.

On 18 August, one civilians was wounded by a gunshot as BH men raided Karabiwa, Magdeme.
Boko Haram raided Kolofata, killing a local vigilante and a Nigerian national and looting homes.

A military air raid on Boko Haram positions in Sambisa forest kill 300, including Boko Haram commanders known as Abubakar Mubi, Malam Nuhu and Malam Hamman. Additionally, Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau is believed either injured or killed.

Boko Haram fighters riding on bicycles sacked Shawa village in Askira/Uba LGA of Borno state in the early hours of Sunday. Though no dead body has been found, [witnesses] said several villagers were missing.

source: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale; Camer.be
notes: Three civilians were killed and around 20 others wounded on Sunday in a suicide attack in in Mora, a town inCameroons far north near the Nigerian border. Another civilian died later of his wounds.
Boko Haram attacks Kuburvwa (Kuburihu) village, near Chibok, killing 11 residents and abducting others.
On 23 August, some Boko Haram elements attacked Tchakamari, Mora, on Natione Route n1. One dead and some shops looted.
Troops of Operation Lafia Dole have killed two senior Boko Haram commanders and several other insurgents (numbers not known) at Darul Jamel on the fringes of Sambisa forest in Borno

source: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale; Camer.be
notes: Four Chadian soldiers have been killed after a mine planted by Boko Haram Islamists destroyed their vehicle. The explosion occurred in Kaiga Kindji, near the border of Chad and Niger.
On 27 August, some BH men attacked Gakara, Kolofata: 4 dead, cattle and food seized.

The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) on Tuesday destroyed a new camp being operated by the Boko Haram sect between Malam Fatori and Kangarwa in northern Borno State. The attack which was conducted overnight followed intelligence reports. Causalities not known.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ala Lumshe, near Marte. Following a period of battle air forces drove back the insurgents. Causalities not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: In-fighting between Boko Haram factions - those allied to ISIL backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi and those of Abubakar Shekau - over a leadership tussle in Zuwa village in Marte district, killing an unspecified number.
Cameroonian forces prevented a Boko Haram raid on the Kerawa area about 7km away from the Nigerian border.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: In-fighting between Boko Haram factions - those allied to ISIL backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi and those of Abubakar Shekau - over a leadership tussle in Yele and Arafa. In Yele, the Barnawi faction killed three people from the Shekau camp, injured one and took one with them, while several were killed in Arafa
A civilian was killed and 2 children were kidnapped during a Boko Haram raid in the Gouzoudou area near Kolofata. Several shops were also looted.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 5 civilians were killed and 2 wounded in a Boko Haram attack on Toumour (allegedly the first in 3 months). The attackers rode into town on camels and burned buildings before treating towards Nigeria. They were opposed by locals who were armed with bows and arrows.
The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) destroyed a Boko Haram camp at Tumbun Rego in Northern Borno. Causalities not known. Source dated 02/09.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 2 Nigerien soldiers were killed and 2 others injured when their vehicle hit an IED planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters near Baroua.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
notes: Two soldiers of the Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJTF, were on Thursday killed in an explosion while fighting Boko Haram insurgents in the northern part of Borno State near the Cameroon border, location not reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
notes: Members of the MNJTF clear 12 villages and kill four members of Boko Haram during operation in northern Borno.
On 9 September, BH elements attacked Aissa Karde, Mora: one dead, 4 house burned down and 2 oxes killed.
Members of Boko Haram attacked a motorist along a highway connecting Maiduguri and Monguno (at Kulukawuya village, 50 kilometres from Maiduguri) killing a driver and wounding passengers.
On 10 September, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine in Djebrili, Mayo Sava. 6 wounded.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Nigerien and Chadian armed forces conducted airstrikes against Boko Haram positions ahead of a planned offensive.

Military forces attack an attack Boko Haram at three locations in Geidam LGA - at Jororo, Tombaeji and Gajire - killing four.
Military forces attack an attack Boko Haram at three locations in Geidam LGA - at Jororo, Tombaeji and Gajire - killing four.
On 15 September, a local militia was killed by Boko Haram elements in Bakaresse, Mayo Sava.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On Sept.30, a spokesman of Nigers defense ministry claimed that 123 Boko Haram militants and 14 Nigerien soldiers have been killed in joint operations with Chadian forces in the Diffa area since the beginning of July (7 soldier and 38 Boko Haram fatalities coded in other events; new fatalities divided between July, August and September in 3 events). 29 soldiers were also wounded and 2 Boko Haram members captured.
In September, the military post in Ardebe, Logone et Chari, was attacked by BH elements: one soldier dead and weapons seized.
Air forces flying F-7NIs conduct a series of air strikes at Tumbin Gini and Tumbin Kayewa in northern Borno. "Many" casualties.
On 16 September, Boko Haram men attacked Sandawadjiri, Mayo Sava: two wounded and two people kidnapped.
Boko Haram opens fire on a group of churchgoers in Kwamjilari Gana, eight dead.

The Nigerian Army encountered Boko Haram members foraging for food, ambushed troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole escorting commercial vehicles from Damboa to Maiduguri at Sanda general area, Borno State. Six civilian dead, three soldiers injured.
Boko Haram attacks Talari, beheading the village leader, his son and shooting two others.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 3 Boko Haram members were captured by villagers after they attempted to enter their area near Diffa during the night. They were later transferred to the local gendarmerie.

3 civilians were killed (4 fatalities including the bomber) when a vigilante attempted to stop a suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber. The bomber was allegedly headed to Mora but was prevented from reaching his target by members of the Djakana vigilance committee.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
notes: The Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) has recaptured Malam Fatori, a border town on the shores of Lake Chad, from Boko Haram after a fierce battle. Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria, IMN, protested in the streets of Abuja, demanding the immediate release of their leader, Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky, who has been by the military since last year December. Fifteen Boko Haram dead (Premium Times). Following the battle, West African arm of the Islamic State (ISIS) claimed Boko Haram killed forty military members, though the military denies this number.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
source: Agence France Presse -- English; Agence Congolaise de Presse (French)
notes: 4 Chadian soldiers were killed in a raid by Boko Haram fighters into Chad near the Djoroye area on the border with Niger. 6 others were injured. Boko Haram allegedly lost 7 fighters in the fighting.
Boko Haram attacked an army position at Logomani, 110km northeast of Maiduguri city, killing four soldiers. The military claimed 22 Boko Haram died in the firefight.
Boko Haram ambushed a convoy late on Sunday near Bama, 70km southeast of Maiduguri, resulting in the deaths of an army officer, three soldiers, and three attackers
Boko Haram attacks Kwang village, near Daggu, battling a unnamed local militia group. The attackers were repelled. Casualties not known.

The Nigerian military has lost an officer and three other soldiers with 19 others including three members of militia groups (not named) seriously injured in a Boko Haram ambush in Borno State. The attack began with the detonation of an IED, followed by an attack.
On 26 September, 2 people were abducted, along with some food, following the incursion of BH elements.
Boko Haram attacks the village of Kubirivour, Boftari and Kuburmbalah, near Chibok. Eight fatalities.
Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Bulabulin, kill nine and wound others.
On 30 September, 4 people were abducted by Boko Haram men in Mouria, Mayo Sava.
On 1 October, Cameroonian soldiers intercepted 8 suspects BH men in Amchide, killing 2 and seizing their animals.
A Cameroonian soldier was killed and at least 2 others wounded in an attack on the Dambore-Ardebe outpost in Makari district. The attackers also burn down the outpost.
On 3 October, an attack by BH fighters to Double was repelled by Cameroonian army.
Troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole Thursday at about 6.30 a.m., intercepted a male suicide bomber on the outskirts of Maiduguri and neutralised the bomber and later the bomb he strapped on himself.

Boko Haram fighters attacked a Joint Multinational Force checkpost in the Sagme area of Maraki district. They killed one person and injured 4 police officers. Soldiers then arrived and engaged in a gunfight with the militants which lasted into the early hours of the morning (Oct.6-7).
Two suspected female suicide bombers were shot dead by soldiers as they attempted to attack a military base in Gwoza, Borno state. Perpetrators were Boko Haram suspects.

Boko Haram fighters attacked a Joint Multinational Force checkpost in the Sagme area of Maraki district. They killed one person and injured 4 police officers. Soldiers then arrived and engaged in a gunfight with the militants which lasted into the early hours of the morning (Oct.6-7).
On 9 October, Boko Haram men attacked Labadou, Mora: 2 dead, several wounded and several goods seized.
Boko Haram attacks Kwashebe village, killing five residents and injuring others before looting foodstuffs.
A suspected Boko Haram IED targets a military escort in the Mura Garage area of the city, killing between 10 and 18.
Air raids in the "last one week" target Boko Haram position sin Smabisa Forest, claiming the lives of "many."
On 12 October, Cameroonian soldiers and part of the population put some BH fighters on the run following an incursion. 1 BH man dead.
On 15 October, an exchange of fire between Boko Haram men and Cameroonian soldiers was reported in Ardori, Mayo Sava.
On 15 October, Boko Haram fighters attacked Ganse, Mayo Sava: 1 dead and goods seized.
Thirteen are wounded when Boko Haram attacks a military location in Gashigar. The forces exited the area the following day.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 17 October 2016. IS West Africa attacked a joint military position of Niger and Nigeria in Gashager, killing 20, injuring at least 13, and seizing weapons and military equipments.
On 19 October, the army post in Djebrili, Mayo Sava, was attacked by Boko Haram men: 1 soldier dead, 5 wounded, weapons seized.
Hunters, tasked to fight Boko Haram by military forces, kill seven at Ghantsa area of Makwan Village in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State.
A suicide attack occurred in the Waramide area of Kaigamari district, near Kolofata. The bomber detonated their explosives, killing 1 other person and wounding another.

A suicide attack occurred in the Sandawadjiri locality. 2 suspected Boko Haram bombers were spotted by a vigilance committee in the area, resulting in one detonated their explosives and injuring 5 members of the committee. The other escaped.
On 24 October, Boko Haram men attacked a herders' camp by night in Matakaya, Amchide: 2 herders dead and a herd seized.
On 24 October, a kamikaze exploded himself in Sandawadjiri: 3 dead and 6 wounded.
On 28 October, 5 Boko Haram men attacked a truck in Dabanga, Logone et Chari: 1 dead and a woman kidnapped.
On 28 October, Boko Haram fighters attacked Gakara, Mayo Sava: 2 people kidnapped and goods seized.
More than 30 people were allegedly killed and dozens injured when [Boko Haram] and troops clashed in Golgiri village in Damboa local government area of Borno State on Saturday.
Two suicide blasts detonate during the morning hours near an IDP camp in Maiduguri. At least nine deaths reported, 24 injured. Boko Haram suspected as perpetrators.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Five soldiers, three vigilantes and a civilian joint task force (JTF) member were killed during a Boko Haram ambush in Talala and Ajigin axis of southern Borno State on Sunday.
A military sniper shoots a suspected suicide bomber who was believed to have been targeting a IDP camp in Maiduguri.
On 31 October, vigilantes killed a BH suspect in Agzawaya.
Military forces clear several Boko Haram camps in Marte LGA, and rescued 38 of their prisoners. Six Boko Haram fatalities reported.
Military forces foil a Boko Haram suicide attempt in Gubio, shoot eight assailants.
On 2 November, an army patrol was ambushed by Boko Haram men in Gassama, Dabanga: one wounded.
Military forces kill five suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers in Yamtaji. One soldier lost.
Troops on patrol kill two members of Boko Haram along Monguno-Brimari road in Borno.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Malam Fatori, killing 14. Five soldiers reported dead.

Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed 'Operation Karya Gwuiwa.' The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.
Boko Haram attacks Akwada, 10 kilometres from Chibok, killing two soldiers in a gunfight. The attackers also torched the village.

Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed 'Operation Karya Gwuiwa.' The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed 'Operation Karya Gwuiwa.' The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

Military forces cleared the Boko Haram controlled areas of Geram, Bulankassa and Chukungudu on the "southern fringes" of the Lake Chad region and rescued 85 hostages "at the weekend". One soldier believed dead in the operation.
One soldier and 13 Boko Haram dead after the latter staged an attack in Kangarwa.
On 8 November, an army truck was hit by a landmine in Waliassi, Mayo Sava: 3 wounded.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: The security situation in the Far North region was marked by Boko Haram attacking the positions of the defense and security forces in Cameroonian territory in the locality of Sandawadjiri near Kolofata, Nov. 9. The report states about twenty fighters of Boko Haram killed, weapons and ammunition seized.
Soldiers in the early hours of Friday shot three Boko Haram suicide bombers at in Umarari village, near Mulai towards Maiduguri.
On 11 November, 20 Boko Haram fighters were killed during a Cameroonian army ambush in Cheripouri, Mayo Sava.
Dasa and Duwabayi, both in Monguno Local Government Area, were attacked by the Boko Haram insurgents over two days. 22 deaths reported.
One lieutenant colonel and eight soldiers dead after a Boko Haram attack on government forces between Bita and Piridang, Borno State.
Dasa and Duwabayi, both in Monguno Local Government Area, were attacked by the Boko Haram insurgents over two days. 22 deaths reported.

A group described as "local hunters" rescue eight Boko Haram prisoners in Sambisa Forest as they fled a "fierce battle" between the sect and military forces. The battle and rescue occurred "last week" (source dated 23/11). Details limited, including location and causalities.
On 17 November, Boko Haram raid on Labado was repelled by local militia.
Military air forces bomb a Boko Haram position at Ngoshe. Causalities not known.

Five suicide bombers targeted a police checkpoint and a bus station near a Maidguri transit camp in the eastern suburbs, killing four of themselves and two civilian self-defence fighters. The fifth bomber was arrested.
On 18 November, two farmers were killed by Boko Haram men in Waza.

Two suicide bombers in the early hours of 18/11 killed themselves at a police checkpoint near the Federal High Court Complex in the Jiddari Polo area of Maiduguri, after police officers on guard tried to stop them from advancing towards their post. A third bomber was arrested. No other causalities. Later investigations led authorities to believe a secondary target may have been a Catholic Church.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 3 civilians were killed in a raid by Boko Haram on Wor village. The attackers also burned some huts before retreating.
Military air forces bomb a Boko Haram position at Kangarwa. Causalities not known.
Military forces gun down a Boko Haram suicide bomb as he attempted to detonated a pack near an IDP camp in Maiduguri. A similar attack was carried out near the camp the day before.
On 19 November, 70 Boko Haram fighters ambushed a truck and an army pick-up between Waza and Zigue on the Route n1. One wounded.
On 19 November, 20 fishermen were attacked by Boko Haram men in Toumbou Ali, Logone et Chari: 3 dead, 2 wounded and 1 kidnapped.
Boko Haram attacked Thlaimaklama village in Chibok Local government area of Borno state "at the weekend", destroying several homes.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber was killed by soldiers in Kolofata.
Suspected Boko Haram fighters attempted to raid the town of Ndiguina but were repulsed.
5 Cameroonian soldiers and a vigilance committee member were killed in an attack by Boko Haram on a gendarmerie station on the island of Darack, near the Nigerian border.
Military forces ambush a Boko Haram group at Goneri, Kukawa LGA, capturing two trucks. Several members of Boko Haram were reported injured as they fled.
A Cameroonian soldier was injured in another attack on Darack, a day after 6 people were killed in an attack in the same locality.
6 soldiers were wounded in a landmine blast planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters in the Limani area.
On 23 November, 2 BH kamikazes were killed by local militia while approaching some schools in Mora.
Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.

Two are killed in a Boko Haram suicide attack on a Maiduguri motor park.
2 female suicide bombers were killed in an attempted attack on Mora, while one blowing herself up, and the other shot dead by the soldiers.

Two members of youth vigilantes of Chibok Local Government Area of Borno state and scores of suspected members of Boko Haram were killed in an encounter during patrol in Shawa village of Damboa Local Government Area.
30 suspected Boko Haram members were captured in the Darack area of the Far North (near Ngouma).
On 25 November, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed Boko Haram men in Darack, Logone et Chari: 9 Boko Haram men dead.
On 25 November, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed Boko Haram men in Kolofata: 64 BH dead, 55 weapons, 3 motos and 40 bikes seized.

Boko Haram elements attempt to ambush government officials along Bama road in Gwoza LGA, between Pulka and Maiduguri. The officials, who were escorted by soldiers, provided resistance and fought off the attackers. 30 Boko Haram dead.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: 54 members of Boko Haram, two soldiers and two members of the Civilian JTF are killed "over the course of a week" in Sambisa Forest. Military and JTF deaths occurred at Bita - other locations and dates not known.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers struck a Madagali market on 09/12, killing at least 57 and injuring 177. 59 dead inclusing bombers
Two girls, aged "seven or eight" detonate suicide packs on their person at a Maiduguri market, killing themselves and wounding at least 17 others. Boko Haram suspected.
A commanding officer and several soldiers (numbers unknown) are killed in a Boko Haram IED ambush outside of Gudumbali.
A senior military officer is killed in a Boko Haram IED explosion along a road in Kukawa LGA, near Baga.
2 cattle traders were killed by Boko Haram fighters in the Grea area, near Kolofata.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)

"In the past week" (reference made on 21/12) military forces raid areas on the Sambisa Forest, rescuing over 1,880 civilians being held by Boko Haram and arrest "hundreds" of insurgents. At least 21 of those rescued are believed to be of the "Chibok Girls."
Two suicide bombers were on Sunday night killed as their weapon went off as they attempted to invade Maiduguri at Muna garage. Several nearby residents were reported injured.
On 23 December, a Boko Haram attack was repelled by Cameroonian soldiers: 1 soldier wounded.

notes: On or around 23 December 2016, IS West Africa militants attacked and killed 4 Nigerian soldiers and seized two vehicles, weapons and ammunitions in Yobe.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber killed 3 (including the bomber) and wounded 5 in Mora.
On 25 December, 10 Boko Haram fighters raided Chaode, Zigague. One kidnapped.

Two Boko Haram suicide bombers are foiled after they are stopped by a local militia described only as a vigilante group. The first bomber detonated a bomb pack, killing only herself. Following the first explosion the militia physically attacked the second bomber. The bombers pack was later reported detonated. Two deaths total.

Hunters clash with Boko Haram at Karetu "a week ago" (source dated 06/01). Fifteen of the hunters were reported dead, five of whom were beheaded, after their remains were found between Gubio and Mobbar Local Government Areas.
On 29 December, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed 3 Boko Haram fighters in Wambashe, Kolofata. One BH fighter dead.

On December 30, 2016 at about 1330hrs, the troops arrested a confirmed Boko Haram member at Goni Kalla. While the suspect was being moved from Goni Kalla to Damaturu, the Boko Haram member attempted to escape by jumping out of the vehicle. He was therefore shot and killed.
Boko Haram attacks military forces at Rann, leading to a three hour battle. Fifteen Boko Haram dead.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate a pack at a market late into the evening, killing herself and injuring one other.

15 hunters are beheaded by Boko Haram in Gubio LGA.

On 3 January, Boko Haram fighters attacked Glem, Dabanga: one civilian wounded by gunfire, some food were seized.
Soldiers repelled an early morning Boko Haram attack on Dar village, Madagali LGA. No casualties reported from the military side.
On 4 January, a Boko Haram incursion in Sandawadjiri, Mayo Sava, was repelled by local militia.
Military forces, along with a local civilian militia group, gun down three would be suicide bombers as they attempted to ender Madagali's Gulak market.
Nigerian troops have killed three would-be Boko Haram suicide bombers, when they tried to ram into troops along Dutse, Ngoshe in Gwoza area of the state.

On January 5, 2017 at about 0745hrs, troops conducted clearance operation along DAMASAK - GASHIGAR road. The troops successfully cleared DUOMA, ASAGA, GASHIGAR and other surrounding villages. At ASAGA(r) village, [military forces] encountered and dislodged some BHT elements. Causalities not known.
On 6 January, Boko Haram fighters attacked Ngourou and were repelled by Cameroonian soldiers.
On 7 January, Cameroon soldiers and Boko Haram men clashed in Igawa, Mora. Two dead and two wounded.

Five soldiers, including a captain were killed Saturday evening in an evening attack launched by suspected Boko Haram militants on 27 Taskforce Brigade of the Nigeria Army in Buni Yadi, Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State. A source reported military forces shot "two scores" of the attackers as they fled.

A senior officer and 3 others soldiers were killed when Boko haram attacked a military location near Maiduguri. The attackers were trailed to a village where one of them was found dead, probably from gunshot injuries.

No fewer than 67 Boko Haram fighters were shot dead by troops in the latest gun battle in Metele, Wulge, Manawasi, Garel and Bulakesa villages of Borno State, which also claimed the lives of six soldiers. The military forces were able to clear the area of Boko Haram. One reports holds six Boko Haram in Metele. Additionally, the soldiers cleared areas from DOGON CHUKU [to] TUMBUN RAGO.
Four persons, including two Boko Haram suicide bombers died in a suicide attack at Kaleri area of Gwange in Maiduguri.

Boko Haram attacked Cinki Gundu, near Monguno, killing an officer and six soldiers. Eight others injured.
