notes: Suspected Boko Haram militants killed an RIB soldier in an attack in the Kolofata area.
Boko Haram attacks a group of soldiers in the Old Marte area of the city. Two dead, eight wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: Suspected Boko Haram fighters ambushed RIB soldiers, killing 3, in the Kolofata area. This followed a similar attack the day before.
Two soldiers are dead following a Boko Haram attack "close to the Nigerian border [with] the Republic of Chad."
2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in Kolofata as they attempted to target Cameroonian military forces. One died after detonating their bomb, while the other was killed by gunfire.
On 11 January, a 70-years-old man was killed by Boko Haram men in Afade, Makari.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On 11 January 2017, 13 Nigerian soldiers were killed and others injured in an attack by IS West Africa militants in the town of Anjini in Borno.

2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed after detonating their bombs when confronted by vigilance committees members in the Double area of the Far North. One vigilance committee member was injured in the attack.
A Boko Haram planted IED kills two military officers - a captain and lieutenant - at Golgore River Bank in Damboa Local Government Area in central Borno State at about 11:15 a.m, 12/01.

Three suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers target a checkpoint at the entrance of Madagali. Nine dead (plus bombers), 13 hospitalised. Possible new tactic to avoid detection: One of the bombers carried a baby.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at two different location in Kangarwa. Three soldiers, ten Boko Haram dead. Conflicting sources claim the attack occurred on 14/01.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Beginning on Thursday 13th January 2017, with the assistance of some local vigilantes and civilian JTF, the troops carried out fighting patrols and clearance operations in Awada and Sinbaya villages, both of Dikwa LGA. 13 Boko Haram fatalities over two days. The soldiers also carried out similar clearance operation at Anaduwa village, where they recovered a number of hostages and equipment. Some sources claim the battle began on 12/01.
An Improvised Explosive Device, planted by Boko Haram, detonated and killed an army captain, a lieutenant and injured a few soldiers.
On 14 January, Cameroonian fighters ambushed Boko Haram fighters in Goudale, Mokolo. 8 BH dead and 3 arrested.
Two members of Boko Haram kidnap and kill a young boy after he identified them to authorities.
Hunters and vigilantes on 14/01 repelled an attack from Boko Haram insurgents on Sabongari village in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State by killing seven of the fighters.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Beginning on Thursday 13th January 2017, with the assistance of some local vigilantes and civilian JTF, the troops carried out fighting patrols and clearance operations in Awada and Sinbaya villages, both of Dikwa LGA. 13 Boko Haram fatalities over two days. The soldiers also carried out similar clearance operation at Anaduwa village, where they recovered a number of hostages and equipment. Some sources claim the battle began on 12/01.
16 bodies were found in the Gnam-Gnam area. They are suspected to have been killed by Boko Haram.

Six dead after suspected Boko Haram detonate two suicide explosives, first at a mosque, then second at the University of Maiduguri. Among the dead include a lecturer. Abubakar Shekau later formally declared responsibility.
Nigerian air forces strike a Boko Haram position about 1 nautical mile south of Tumbum Rego in northern Borno. Casualties not known.
On 18 January, 2 children were hit by a landmine in Soueram, Fotokol. 2 wounded.
Boko Haram abducts two young boys in Maiduguri, killing one three days later after their father could not pay them they money they demanded.

source: Xinhua News Agency - French; Xinhua General News Service
notes: At least 3 people were killed and 4 others injured in a suicide attack by a suspected Boko Haram member in the Madana district of the city of Kousseri.

Around 15 Boko Haram fighters were killed when the jihadists attacked a town in northeastern Nigeria, two days after the air force accidentally killed hundreds of people. Date not clear, event may have occurred on 19/01.
On 20 January, the incursion of 15 Boko Haram men was repelled in Korgui, Mora by Cameroonian soldiers.
On 21 January, Boko Haram men could hoist 2 BH flags in Kolofata during an incursion. Cameroonian soldiers brought them down after confronting them.
On 21 January, the Cameroonian army launched a military operation at the Waza Park, where the presence of around 300 armed men was reported.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 2 Nigerien soldiers were killed and 7 others wounded in an attack by a large number of Boko Haram fighters on a military base in Geskerou in the Diffa region. 3 army vehicles were also torched.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Many Boko Haram fighters were killed (coded as 10) by Nigerien air strikes as they attempted to retreat through the marshes near Lake Chad after they attacked a military base at Geskerou in the Diffa region.
On 22 January, Boko Haram men attacked Blakafe, Mora: one person was wounded by gunfire and some food was seized.
A Policeman was killed and 7 rifles carted away when gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked a divisional police station.
Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members abducted about seven women and killed three other persons when they attacked Ndagu Village of Askira-Uba Local Government Area of Borno State.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers target Maiduguri during the early morning hours - one at 2am, and the other at 5. Only fatalities reported were that of the bombers. Two other injures.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers, a male and female, attempted to enter a Kariari mosque. They were spotted by security volunteers (Civilian JTF) who accosted them. The perpetrators detonated their explosives which killed them on the spot and one security volunteer. Two other people were injured.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Boko Haram (IS supported Barnawi Faction) attacks a military base at Kamuya at 5:30 p.m. from three different directions shooting non-stop for over 30 minutes. Military forces repelled the attack. A "large number" of Boko Haram were said to have been killed in battle with some fleeing the scene with gunshot wounds. One source said three Nigerian soldiers died while some equipment were lost during the battle. A number of soldiers are also said to be missing.

5 soldiers were killed during an invasion of a military camp of 'Operation Lafiya Dole' by Boko Haram in Kamuya village of Buratai ward. It was reported that the insurgents also carted away arms and ammunition. The date of the incident was not stated.

More than 20 people were feared dead after Boko Haram gunmen opened fire on a convoy of motorists travelling under military escort between Maiduguri and Damboa at Korowaso forest. No reported exchange of fire between military and Boko Haram.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and a member of the Civilian Joint Task Force. It was reported that the suicide bomber attempted to enter a housing estate.
1 person was killed and 3 wounded in an attack by Boko Haram fighters on the Ouro-Moussa Kambo locality of Fotokol district.

An 8 year-old female suicide bomber was on 30/01 detonated and killed while trying to gain access to an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Banki town in Borno state. No other casualty reported.

At least 4 people were killed, including 3 bombers, in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at Double market in the Far North near the Nigerian border. Other sources estimated as many as 16 had died. Many of those injured were taken to Mora hospital.

An armed group attacked a UN Technical Monitoring Team, killing five individuals a UN independent contractor, three Nigerian nationals and one Cameroonian national in the vicinity of Hosere Jongbi, near Kontcha, Cameroon, about 700 kilometres north of the capital Yaounde. A soldier of the Rapid Intervention Battalion belonging to the escort of the team was also wounded.
Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a Maiduguri mosque. One person was killed from the explosion apart from the suicide bomber. The bomber was belied to be between 8-10 years of age.
Six members of Boko Haram and three soldiers are dead following a camp clearing battle in Damboa LGA. Locations cleared include Dulsa and Buk.
Boko Haram ambush a police patrol in Biu LGA, resulting in one death. A second officer was injured.
Six members of Boko Haram and three soldiers are dead following a camp clearing battle in Damboa LGA. Locations cleared include Dulsa and Buk.
On 3 February, two women kamikazes attempted to launch a suicidal attack in Kerawa: one exploded herself under the pressure of militia and the second was killed by the militia.
Boko Haram ambushed a police convoy at the village of Kubwa in Damboa local government area on the highway between Maiduguri-Damboa road. One death, three injures.
On 4 February, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed Boko Haram forces in Gakara, Kolofata. 6 soldiers wounded and 7 BH killed.

Two people were killed by Boko Haram during an invasion on Sasawa, Damaturu. The perpetrators had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed. Causalities of the military attack are not known.
Two people were killed by Boko Haram during an invasion on Sasawa, Damaturu. The perpetrators had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed.
6 Cameroonian soldiers were injured in a clash with Boko Haram fighters at Gakara.
Suspected Boko Haram sect members have launched attack on a military base and burnt much of Sasawa town, dislodging the soldiers and overtaking the area. Causalities not known.
On 6 February, vigilante militia ambushed Boko Haram men in Bakeresse, Kerawa. 1 AK47, a motorcycle were recovered.

The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) Borno Command, on 07/02 intercepted two female suicide bombers, who tried to ram into motorists at the NNPC Mega Station along Damboa Road, Maiduguri. One was shot and killed and the other was arrested. The perpetrates were believed to be with Boko Haram.
Seven military forces are dead and 19 injured following a clash with Boko Haram along Ajiri-Dikwa road in in Mafa LGA. Agence France Presse reports 8 dead.
A man was killed by Boko haram insurgents during an attack on Chibok. A 5-year-old boy was abducted during the raid. Another source reported that the victim was an Islamic scholar.
Boko Haram ambushed a group of soldiers along the Ajiri-Dikwa road in Borno State. The ensuing clash left 30 Boko Haram and seven soldiers dead.
On 11 February, vigilante militia intercepted 4 Boko Haram fighters in Waramide, close to Sandawadjiri: 1 BH killed.
Boko Haram attacked Mussa village, destroying houses. Causalities not known.
On 12 February, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed Boko Haram men in Bia, Mora: 2 motos seized.

Boko Haram attack Mifa, Chibok LGA killing an Islamic scholar and breaking the hands of an unnamed boy. Soldiers stationed in Chibok were quickly drafted and we're able to repel the attack killing one of the attackers.

Boko Haram attack Mifa, Chibok LGA killing an Islamic scholar and breaking the hands of an unnamed boy. Soldiers stationed in Chibok were quickly drafted and we're able to repel the attack killing one of the attackers.

The Minister of Communications reported that at least 60 Boko Haram fighters were killed (4 fatalities reported in other events), a stronghold destroyed and a large stockpile of weapons seized during an offensive by Cameroonian army forces in the Mandara Mountains area since Jan.26. The minister also reported more than 5,000 people had been freed from captivity by Boko Haram. 20 suspected Boko Haram fighters were also arrested.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: "Dozens" of Boko Haram members including civilians were feared dead in a crossfire that ensued between military troops/Civilian JTF and the group, most of whom were suicide bombers who attempted to infiltrate Maiduguri. The attack occurred in two stages. First, suicide bombers attempted to attack a military escort to Gamboru Ngala, then an exchange of gunfire around Muna Garrage general area. Unconfirmed report also has it that six members of civilian JTF sustained critical injuries while attempting to repel the attacks. Premium Times claims 11 dead.

Suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack in the midst of 13 trucks along Maiduguri/ Mafa road during the late hours of the day. The bomber was reported dead, along with destruction of the trucks. The attack was likely in coordination with the attack on Maiduguri.
3 Cameroonian soldiers were killed when their vehicle hit a mine planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters at Gouzda Vreket in Mayo-Tsanaga.

Boko Haram fired repeatedly at a Mi-17 military helicopter on a humanitarian mission between Maiduguri and Gwoza, injuring one airman. A fighter jet and helicopter gunship were immediately scrambled and retaliated, killing two scores of the insurgents at the located threat.

Three female Boko Haram suicide bombers stormed a motor park in the state capital, blew themselves and 2 others up. The 2 civilian victims were among the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) waiting to return to their homes. Another conflicting source reported 'scores' died in the attack.
On 17 February, 12 Boko Haram men attacked Doudo, Bogo: 4 motos and other goods seized. They were catched by Cameroonian soldiers. 4 dead.

Scores of Boko Haram and civilians lost their lives in an attack by heavily armed fighters as they attempted to storm Maiduguri through its border with Mafa. It is not clear if military forces were involved.
Boko Haram attacked Yaza-Kumaza village at about 4 p.m. on 19/02, killing three.
Boko Haram insurgents attacked Yaza-Kumaza village and killed no fewer than 4 persons.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 3 soldiers were killed in the Diffa area in an attack by suspected Boko Haram fighters.
On 21 February, Boko Haram forces were repelled from Ganse, Kolofata by Cameroonian soldiers.
At least seven soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram attack on military positions in Gajiram on 22/02.
2 people were killed (including a bomber) and 2 wounded in a suicide attack by suspected Boko Haram militants in Amchide.
On 24 February, Boko Haram fighters attacked Kouyape, Mayo Sava. One local militia member was killed, three shops were raided and motos seized.
The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) has struck a Boko Haram base at Tagoshe/Mandara Mountain general area about 10km Southwest of Gwoza in Northern Borno. 24 Boko Haram fatalities reported.
Military air forces destroy a Boko Haram anti-aircraft gun, as well as several vehicle travelling in a convoy at Talala, northern Borno. Causalities not known.
A villager was killed by Boko Haram fighters in the Waza area.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Security forces arrest three Chadian Boko Haram members in (Barnawi faction) in Gombe after shooting one in the leg.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: A male suicide bomber who disguised as a woman was killed in Borno on 27/02 by members of the state Civilian-Joint Task Force (CJTF). Exact location within the state not known.

From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.
18 Boko Haram militants were killed by the troops when the insurgents invaded Kumuya in Gujba LGA. It was reported that the perpetrators attacked the village to cart away food but were overpowered.

Troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole have captured 14 Boko Haram and "neutralised" many others during a clearing operation in Chikum Gudu, northern Borno state. Four soldiers wounded. Weapons recovered.

From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.

Multiple bomb blasts hit Maiduguri early on 03/03. The attacks were carried out by suspected suicide bombers around the NNPC depot on Damboa Road. No causality reported except for the three bombers. While two detonated their explosives a soldier shot and killed the third. Several fuel tankers were destroyed as result of the explosions. Officials blamed Boko Haram.

From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.

2 suspected BK suicide bombers were killed by soldiers in the Boudoua area of Limani.

On 6 March, 2 women kamikazes were killed by Cameroonian soldiers in Wambashe, Mayo Sava.
Air Forces bomb a Boko Haram logistics base in Sambisa. The base may have been a fuel depot, as the strike caused a large explosion. Causalities not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On or around 7 March 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked and killed 4 soldiers of the Nigerian army and captured one soldier during clashes near Lake Chad in Borno.
A suspected BK suicide bomber detonated himself in the Magdeme area. No casualties were reported.

From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.

From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.

One soldier was killed and two others declared missing in action during an encounter between troops of Operation Lafiya Dole and Boko Haram at Gwari and Ganye villages (near Kerenoa, which is near Monguno) of Borno State, where a senior Army officer and 13 other soldiers were wounded. Boko Haram causalities not known.
One person was killed and several wounded in an attack by Boko Haram on Goulouzivini village, near Wana.
On 10 March, 11 Boko Haram men attacked Goumouzini. One dead, one wounded and 18 houses burned down.

Military forces "executed a swift operation" against Boko Haram at Manlumudori, Aridi, Filari, Kingimari, Dinamari, Itari and Mirimari villages, presumably in Jigawa and Borno States. Military forces also carried out an aerial bombardment of Subdu village, location not known. Causalities not known - details limited.
During a Boko Haram clearing operation of Cingal, Murye and Mala Maja, Borno State, military forces kill one member of the group and rescue 211 civilians.

Military forces "executed a swift operation" against Boko Haram at Manlumudori, Aridi, Filari, Kingimari, Dinamari, Itari and Mirimari villages, presumably in Jigawa and Borno States. Military forces also carried out an aerial bombardment of Subdu village, location not known. Causalities not known - details limited.

Military forces also carried out an aerial bombardment of Subdu village, location not known. Causalities not known - details limited.
Military forces shoot and kill two suspected suicide bombers in (D)Molari area.
On 12 March, Boko Haram fighters attacked a military post in Soueram, Fotokol. 3 BH killed and 2 soldiers wounded.

Nigerian troops fighting to rout remnants of Boko Haram in the North East have carried out a major offensive against several hideouts of the militants in Kala Balge Local Government area of Borno State killing scores while many ran into the bush with bullet wounds. 455 captives were freed in the operation. Among the villages cleared included Shirawa. Other location names not known.

Nigerian troops fighting to rout remnants of Boko Haram in the North East have carried out a major offensive against several hideouts of the militants in Kala Balge Local Government area of Borno State killing scores while many ran into the bush with bullet wounds. 455 captives were freed in the operation. Among the villages cleared included Shirawa. Other location names not known.

300 members of Boko Haram attempt an attack on Magumeri, but are repelled by military forces. The attackers "escaped with gunshot wounds." "Many" soldiers reported dead (Associated Press). A military base was destroyed in the attack.
Boko Haram releases a video of the execution of three accused of spying. Location (likely in Sambisa Forest or outer Borno State), date of the execution not known.
4 army personnel were injured when a truck travelling between Zamga and Djibrili in the Mayo-Moskota area hit a landmine planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters .

source: L'Oeil du Sahel; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: At least 3 Boko Haram militants were killed during an attack carried out on Cameroonian navy positions in Soueram area, near Ngouma. At least 2 Cameroonian military personnel were injured and taken to Kousseri for treatment. Other sources said as many as 9 were killed during the attack, mostly Boko Haram fighters.
Troops of the Nigerian Army have reportedly killed two Boko Haram fighters at Gujari village in Mafa Local Government Area in the early hours of 20/03, destroyed their hideout.

Troops have destroyed a Boko Haram Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) factory at Gombole village in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno. The factory was found during a clearance operation in the village. The forces 'neutralised several' insurgents, recovered weapons, and rescued hostages. One soldier was reported injured during the operation.
Suspected Boko Haram fighters stormed Kalari Abdiye village, near Konduga killing three people on suspicion of collaborating with the military.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: A Boko Haram-planted IED detonates along the Dikwa-Maiduguri road killing two members of the Civilian JTF and injuring three others.

Suspected Boko Haram members attacked communities of Kalari, Mittiri, Akalli and Arribbari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State kidnapping 10 people. The source reports all 10 were abducted from Kalari.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: A Nigerien soldier and 3 suspected Boko Haram militants were killed, while 11 others were injured, in an ambush by the militants against a Niger/Chad joint military patrol in the Bosso area.

Boko Haram attackers killed a civilian who had tried to escape after refusing to pay protection money in Dumba, near the Lake Chad area. Following the attack the perpetrators abducted four women and took a number of cattle.
On 30 March, two kamikaze died in Kourgui, Mayo Sava in the explosion of their charges.
Boko Haram attack Pulka village on 30/03. The attackers abducted 18 girls.
On 31 March, Boko Haram fighters attacked Gakara, Mayo Sava: one civilian wounded, 7 bicycles and 6 sheep seized.

source: L'Oeil du Sahel; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: 2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers set off their explosives at the entrance to Mora, near a technical high school. No other casualties were reported.

Three suicide bombers detonate in the Muna garage and Dusuman areas of the city. The first two, in Muna Garage detonated without injuring any potential targets, and the second, in Dusuman caused one injury.
Boko Haram releases a video of propaganda against its Barnawi Faction, as well of footage of the group flogging a group of villagers. Location, date not known.
On 4 April, Boko Haram fighters were intercepted by some vigilantes. Motos, bicycles and weapons seized.
On 5 April, Boko Haram men attempting to sheltering in a school were repelled by Cameroonian soldiers.
Earlier in April' (source dated 12/04) Boko Haram attacks a military convoy travelling to Gulumba, killing four.
On 05/04 scores of Boko Haram fighters rode on motorcycles into Abbati (Abari), a farming community outside Maiduguri, where they killed seven civilians and stole 360 heads of livestock.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Barnawi faction Boko Haram attack a military base at Wajiro, causing soldiers to flee. The attackers then looted and burned the village, though did not target civilian residents in the area. Agence France Presse reports four military dead.
On 6 April, Boko Haram men attacked Gakara: one woman was raped, CNI and cloth seized.
Boko Haram attackers abducted 13 women at Hambagda, near the Cameroon border.
A suicide bombing by a suspected Boko Haram bomber resulted in 3 killed and 20 wounded in Kolofata.
At least 4 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters in an attack on the locality of Ganei.
Boko Haram killed eight loggers at Kayamla village, near Dolori.
At least 2 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters during an attack in Sandawadjiri.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Military forces in Niger claim they have killed 57 Boko Haram fighters while 15 soldiers and 2 civilians were lightly wounded in Gueskerou in the Diffa region. The Boko Haram fighters had attacked an army position in the area resulting in the clash.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber is shot and killed by security forces while trying to gain access to the University of Maiduguri grounds.

Two Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following a failed attempt on the University of Maiduguri. It is believed the explosive detonations were premature. Boko Haram had unsuccessfully tried enter the school grounds the day before.
Suspected Boko Haram killed a soldier and injured a police officer in a suicide and gun attack on a military checkpoint in Dolori. The attack occurred during the evening hours of 12/04.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Boko Haram-Barnawi faction attacks a military post near Sabon Gari, killing five soldiers and injuring five others. The soldiers were eventually pushed into retreat, where they reorganized and launched a counter attack which was described as 'largely successful.'. Causalities from the second attack not known.

Troops on clearance operations at Jarawa village in Kala Balge Local Government Area of Borno, rescued 1,623 captives held by remnants of Boko Haram after they neutralised 21 Boko Haram during a battle. No military causalities reported.

An explosive device believed to have been planted by Boko Haram insurgents has exploded, killing one and injuring seven other members of a unidentified vigilante group near a bridge at Wulle village, Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State.
A suicide bomber on a bicycle killed a constable and 2 civilians in an attack in Kolofata. 4 others were injured.
Suspected Boko Haram fighters killed one person and abducted 3 girls in Mbereche, near Limani.
On 19 April, Boko Haram men attacked Mbichere, Mayo Sava: 1 dead, 3 girls kidnapped.

A military carrier is struck by a Boko Haram IED along the Ngoshe-Bokkotinta-Pulka axis. Three soldiers were killed in the incident, while two were injured. The troops also lost one gun truck, one mine lab detector device and four AK-47 rifles.
Military forces 'at the weekend' cleared Disa and Patawe of Boko Haram, killing six.
Military forces 'at the weekend' cleared Disa and Patawe of Boko Haram, killing six.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Civilian JTF forces intercept three Boko Haram suicide bombers at Mamanti village Jere LGA, causing one to detonate their pack, and shooting two others.

A 40-year old man was shot last night in Katchimiri (near Doulo) after an incursion of Boko Haram members.

Boko Haram jihadists killed six men in Kijimatari (near Monguno) in an early morning attack. The attackers bronk into the victim's homes, slitting their throats. The attack is believed to be a reprisal.
Boko Haram attacks several villages in Guzamala LGA, killing 12 people.
An explosion from Boko Haram suicide bombers killed 4 people and injured 5 others in Kordo
Boko Haram attacks several villages in Nganzai LGA, killing 15 people.
At least five policemen were seriously injured the afternoon of 23/08 following a suspected suicide attack by Boko Haram in the Muna area of Maiduguri.
Suicide bombing this morning in Mozogo. No details of injuries.
On 23 August, Cameroonian soldiers occupied some localities in the Lac Chad and clashed with Boko Haram men: 4 BH dead.
On 24 August, a Boko Haram raid on Goura, Logone et Chari was repelled by local militia.
At least 15 people killed and 8 others abducted in Gakara (Kolofata).
On 24 August, Boko Haram men attacked Ngorsono, Logone et Chari: 4 civilians dead, 2 wounded and 20 houses burned down.
On 25 August, a Boko Haram raid on Zamga, Mozogo, was repelled by Cameroonian soldiers: 3 civilians and 2 Boko Haram men dead.
3 dead in Zamga in an attack performed by Boko Haram

Rebels burned down homes and stole vehicles and cattle after killing 16 people in two villages near Mora, in Cameroon's Far North province, about 20 kilometers (12 miles) from the border with Nigeria.
On 29 August, Cameroonian soldiers ambushed BH elements who had stolen a herd in Igawa, Mora.
Gunmen mounted on motorcycles (Boko Haram) attacked Ashigashia Village, burning 14 houses before they were repelled by vigilantes.
Magala Kabir village chief and one of his sons were killed in an attack.

Military forces announced on 31/08 that they had "neutralized" five Boko Haram commanders and "many" (coded as 10) of their foot soldiers during operations in the north-east (exact location not known). The commanders names included Abu Dujana, Man Tahiru, Man Chari, Malam Abdullahi Abu Sa'ad and Goni Bamanga. The date(s) of the operation are not known. The operation was jointly conducted with air forces. Abubakar Shekau released a video shortly after the strike denying the military's claims.
Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.

Air forces destroy Boko Haram camps in Garin Maloma area in Sambisa Forest, neutralizing "hundreds." It is believed Boko Haram in the targeted location were planning to disrupt Eid-el Kabir celebrations in the area.
Boko Haram asking ransom & foodstuffs to villagers in exchange for woman abducted in Igawa.
Boko Haram attack an IDP camp in Banki, killing 11.
Three Boko Haram commanders and deputies to Abubakar Shekau (Afdu Kawuri and Abubakar Banishek and Modu Bako) were killed in a military operations at Alafa in Borno on Sallah day.
Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Boko Haram men attempted to kidnap 4 people from Koutou village: three managed to escape, one died.
A man slained yesterday night in Doulou, near Mora by BokoHaram militants
On 3 September, Boko Haram elements raided Kalguiwa, Mayo Sava: 2 people dead.
Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram in Banki, killing "a large number." Several others were wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: A child was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.
Boko Haram ambush and kill four farmers in Bulamari, outside of Maiduguri.
3 dead, 8 people kidnapped, 46 houses burned in Dzaba.

Boko Haram attacked Mallan village near Maiduguri on the evening of 06/09. Three reported dead. The attack was an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia. Boko Haram also attacked Kesa Kura in coordination with this strike.
Boko Haram attacked Kesa Kura village near Maiduguri on the evening of 06/09, killing three. The attack was an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia.

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."
Air forces bomb Boko Haram areas in Zanari, which borders Lake Chad. An "unknown number" were believed to have been killed.

17 Boko Haram fighters stormed Mallan village (near Maiduguri) at about 8:00 am (0700 GMT) on Thursday (07/09), killing two farmers. The group attack the village the previous evening as well. The attacks were an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia.

A group of "local hunters and vigilantes" battle Boko Haram in Buni Tadi area. Two Boko Haram deaths reported, six injuries, weapons recovered and 13 hostages released. Six of the hostages were believed to be children who were abducted in Biu LGA on 19/08.
Two suicide bombers attack Muna Garage area. The bombers were reported dead, five other injuries.
At least seven people were killed when Boko Haram attacked an IDP camp in Ngala. The attack began with RPG fire followed by sustained gunfire.

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."
Military forces ambush a Boko Haram contingent along Ngurosoye-Bama road, neutralizing a "large number" and recovering equipment. Several soldiers were reported wounded.
On 11 September, 2 Boko Haram men clashed with unknown militia in Tallakachi, Mozogo: 1 dead.
On 12 September, a military vehicle was hit by a landmine on the Wambache-Gouloudja axis: one wounded.
5 dead in suicide attack by Boko Haram in Sanda-Wadjiri.
The spouse of Meinta, farmer in Bia village, has been kidnapped last night by Boko Haram armed elements
On 14 September, Boko Haram elements ambushed some Cameroonian traders on the Bodo-Rann axis: 2 dead and 5 kidnapped.
A MNJTF military personnel and 2 vigilantes of Bonderi were killed between Ardori and Woulba, after IED explosion.
On 15 September, some Boko Haram elements attacked the Cameroonian soldiers in the Djebrili area. One soldier was wounded.
On 16 September, 3 Boko Haram men attempted to kidnap a villager in Makary, Logone et Chari.
5 dead in a twin suicide attack this morning in Kossa (two fatalities included for bombers).
Suspected members of Boko Haram invaded Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward in which the attackers killed the Chief Imam of the village alongside four other persons.
Boko Haram suicide bombers have reportedly killed at least 15, others injured. It was gathered that the attack occurred at Mashimari, Konduga, outside Maiduguri. This Day reports the deaths of 12.
Military forces repel Boko Haram attacks at Beta and Pulka; 2 in Beta, 16 in Pulka.
Military forces repel Boko Haram attacks at Beta and Pulka; 2 in Beta, 16 in Pulka.
2 wounded in Sagme attack.
On 20 September, Boko Haram elements raided Mainankoua, Mayo Sava. 2 dead and 2 wounded.
Boko Haram kills nine at an IDP camp in Rann on 20/09.
2 killed people and 2 injuried after Boko Haram attacked Mainankoua village (Kolofata). Many others villagers remain captives.
Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram near Feri-Feri and Tashan Goto axis in Bama on 22/09.
Explosion of a suicide bomber in Kolofata. No civilian casualties.
The body of a soldier, possibly murdered by Boko Haram, was found this morning on the road Zamga-Djibril.
Boko Haram attacks Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward, Magumeri LGA on the night of 24/09 killing an Imam and 20 others.
2 people seriously wounded after BokoHaram incursion in Limani
A suicide bomber killed five people on 26/09 in a mosque in northeast Nigeria at Dikwa. Boko Haram are believed to be responsible.
On 26 September, Boko Haram men attacked Godele, Mayo Tsanaga: 2 people kidnapped. A body was found on 16 October.
On 27 September, Cameroonian forces intervened and evicted Boko Haram men from Nigue, Logone et Chari.
On 27 September, Boko Haram elements raided Doulo, Mayo Sava: one civilian wounded by gunfire.

Boko Haram killed three people and set fire to 150 homes in a raid targeting rural communities in Guzamala local government area. The villages included in the attack were Goram and two neighbouring villages, Lingis and Ajidari.
2 soldiers killed this morning in the explosion of a mine planted by suspected BH militants between Bonderi and Kangarwa
Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram and recover weapons in Malamti, Guzamala LGA. Two of the soldiers were injured in the exchange.
On 29 September, Boko Haram and militia clash in Ashigashiya, Mayo Sava: 14 houses burned down, a bike seized.
A police personnel and an Internally Displaced Person were killed on the evening of 29/09, in crossfire between military troops and Boko Haram in Bocobs, Bama.
The Nigerian Army killed one Boko Haram member after repelling an attack by the insurgents at Bocos village in Bama Local Government Area, Borno State.
Double suicide bombing in Mozogo. 3 dead (2 kamikazes and 1 civilian) .

No fewer than four soldiers of Operation Lafiya Dole were killed with another senior officer and a driver, escaping unhurt when some Boko Haram insurgents ambushed the operational vehicle conveying food for troops along Mafa-Sasawa Military Base in Borno State.
On 3 October, Boko Haram elements raided Fotokol, Logone et Chari: one wounded.
Military forces kill four members of Boko Haram in Bama LGA was the sect attempted two separate attacks on an IDP camp in the area. The two attacks occurred at different times of the day.
On 5 October, Boko Haram elements and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in Limani.
Military forces neutralize two members of Boko Haram at Mayanti, Bama LGA. The event occurred late in the evening hours on 06/10.
On 6 October, Boko Haram men attacked Medina, Logone et Chari, but they were repelled by Cameroonian soldiers.
Military forces kills a Boko Haram cattle rustler at Kirbiri, Gujba LGA. Several others escaped with injuries.
Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Madari, Borno State on 08/10. Premium Times claims Boko Haram were intercepted in Lingir village.
On 9 October, Boko Haram elements raided Ldoutfa, Mayo Tsanaga, shooting on farmers: 2 dead and one wounded. 7 motos seized.
2 civilians killed in Ldaoutsaf in an attack by Boko Haram
On 10 October, 2 kamikazes were discovered by Vigilante militia in Limani, Mayo Sava: one of them blew himself up, killing both.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Yamteke village in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno, kill 15. At least one soldier reported dead.

Four Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following a failed attempt on Umarri. At least one of the bombers targeted a mosque. No other injuries were reported. The source notes the bombers were teenage girls.

Five people (plus the bomber) were killed in a suicide bomb attack when Boko Haram raided Belbelu village, near Kayamla, in the Konduga area of Borno state, at about 10:00 am (0900 GMT). The bomber was accompanied by other gunmen when fired wildly upon their attack of the village.

Military forces rescued a 6 year-old boy from Boko Haram captivity in Bama Local Government Area of Borno on 13/10. The troops also killed three Boko Haram insurgents in gun duel at various insurgents' enclaves in the area.
Boko Haram raids a military location at Marte, killing one soldier and injuring nine others. The attackers carried away weapons.
Military forces "recently" (source dated 14/10) killed 2 fleeing Boko Haram militants in an ambush at Futchinam village in Geidam Local Government Area of Yobe.
Military forces killed Boko Haram 3 insurgents in an ambush in Lingir village on or before 14/10 where they recovered 5 AK-47 rifles, 5 magazines and 11 rounds of 7.62mm (special) ammunition.
On 17 October, an attempt by BH elements to raid a military post in Bounderi failed.
At least three soldiers were killed when Boko Haram fighters ambushed a military convoy in Damboa on 18/10. The Nigerian Tribune reports seven soldiers died.
A vigilante died after walking on a land-mine in Amtchali. 2 wounded.
Boko Haram attacks a group of soldiers in Marte LGA, killing 11.

Air forces carry out a strike on Durwawa area in Konduga LGA. Military intelligence believe the wife of Abubakar Shekau, Mallama Fitdasi, had been killed in air strikes. Other structural damage reported.
Military forces laid ambush to a Boko Haram location at Muzine and killed 61.
Military forces kill three Boko Haram attackers following an ambush at Missini. The soldiers were patrolling the Dikwa - Ngala road at the time.
Military air forces targeted nine Boko Haram camps around Gudumbali on 21/10. 350 reported dead. It had been learned the sect had been gathering in the area to launch attack on the surrounding towns.

Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.

Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.
Ten are injured in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at a Maiduguri IDP camp. It is not known if the bomber was killed in the attack.

Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.

Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.

Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.
On 24 October, Boko Haram elements killed a farmer in Goledje, Mayo Tsanaga.
On 24 October, Boko Haram elements raided Bla-Indali, Mayo Sava and killed a man. Some cattle was seized.
On 24 October, Cameroonian elements ambushed BH men in Gouzda Vreket, Mayo-Moskota: 2 BH men killed and some goods recovered.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the "Civilian JTF", military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the "Civilian JTF", military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the Civilian JTF, military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On 25 October 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked Nigerian army soldiers in Sasawa, killing 8, and injuring a number of others, and seizing vehicles, weapons, and ammunitions.
Military forces kill three Boko Haram and wound others at Lumda in the early morning hours of 26/10. The forces also recovered weapons.
Explosion of 3 kamikazes that night in Mozogo. No other victims registered

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: A teacher was killed by Boko Haram men.

Troops intercepted escaping Boko Haram fighters crossing Maiduguri-Monguno highway at Torowa village during which a fighter was shot dead, while others fled into the nearby bush. The troops recovered an AK-47 rifle with a magazine loaded with19 rounds of 7 62mm ammunition, three mobile phones, a SIM card and pieces of jewellery.
Military forces discover a cache of explosives and neutralize one member of Boko Haram in the northern Borno location of Ngalle.
Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Dure. The force also engaged Boko Haram at Jango, Nduma, Gobara, Bala Ibrahim, Fulani Rogo, Takwala villages.

Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers blew themselves up in what appears to be a failed mission at Magar village in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa state. Reports from witnesses in the area indicated that the two bombers who strapped improvised explosive devices on their bodies sneaked into the village in the early hours of 28/10 but the explosives detonated before they could reach their targets. A woman was however injured in the blast.
Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Dure. The force also engaged Boko Haram at Jango, Nduma, Gobara, Bala Ibrahim, Fulani Rogo, Takwala villages.
The Nigerian Army repelled an attempted attack on Goniri village in Yobe on 28/10. Casualties not known.
On 29 October, Boko Haram elements attacked Zigague, Waza: 2 civilians dead and 2 wounded.
Boko Haram suicide bombers strike in the Muna Garage area. The Borno State Emergency Management Agency on Monday, confirmed that 17 people lost their lives and 18 others wounded.

Four soldiers reportedly died on Monday, while six others sustained injuries when troops of 152 Battalion, 21 Brigade of the Nigerian Army engaged Boko Haram at Banki in Bama LGA. It was reported the Boko Haram also suffered a "heavy loss". A second article from the same source claims 20 Boko Haram dead.
Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram as the fled on horseback at Gambo Yukku forest in Gubio LGA.
At least 11 villagers slaughtered last night in Gouderi
On 31 October, a woman kamikaze exploded herself in Zamga, Mozogo: 6 children dead, 6 wounded.
2 people killed yesterday night at Mada II.
6 dead in a suicide bombing yesterday night in Zamga (including the perpetrator)
Targeted killing of a trader last night in Bogo
3 fighters killed in fighting by the FMM in Mayo-Sava
On 3 November, military operation by the Cameroonian army and Vigilantes against Boko Haram in Double, Mayo Sava: 2 dead and 1 wounded.
On 3 November, Boko Haram elements and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in Blakafe, Mora: one dead, 2 wounded.
At least six people were killed when suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked Jaddannam, Magumeri LGA location. The assailants burned the town and stole livestock.
Army forces kill "dozens" of Boko Haram fighters and rescue a small boy in Banki-Bula Yobe road in Bama Local Government Area of Borno.
3 people killed at Mahola
2 people killed in Kerawa-Mafa
A Boko Haram suicide bomber attempted an attack Irmirsa community, but were shot and killed by soldiers and local hunters before they were able to attack.
A kamikaze killed and another arrested in Igawa by the army

A pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Tsilda on 05/11, killing themselves and two civilians. Another bomber attempted an attack on Irmirsa community, but were shot by soldiers and local hunters before they were able to attack.

At least two civilians were killed when dozens of Boko Haram fighters tried to storm Gulak, in the Madagali area of the far north of Adamawa state. The force of 50 was repelled by military forces in the town. One soldier was killed. "A lot" of Boko Haram KIA. Recorded total as 13. A Vanguard report published the following day claims 42 dead (it is not known if this report accounted for the soldier's death). The attack caused a large portion of the residents to flee for safety.
On 6 November, a Boko Haram incursion in Kerawa, Mayo Tsanaga: 2 civilians dead.
Four suicide bombers attack London Chiki/Kaleri axis of Jere Local Council, killing themselves and injuring eight others.

Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.

Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.

Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.

Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.

Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.

Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.
Incursion in Talakachi. A wounded villager, 3 motorcycles, 4 bicycles and cattle washed away.
Sali Lafia kidnapped in Sandawadjiri, was found killed this morning in Bornori. 2 OTHER villagers (Zara Abba and Wanie Haman) kidnapped at Warawide on the same day.
On 10 November, Cameroonian elements ambushed Boko Haram fighters in Djebrili, Mayo Tsanaga: 3 BH men killed, 2 motos and 3 bikes recovered.
At least three Nigerian soldiers and a militiaman were killed in a Boko Haram ambush in Gwoza on 10/11.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram in Bama LGA 'killing many.' Elsewhere in the LGA military forces cleared a Boko Haram camp and rescued a young prisoner.

At least two persons were killed and many others feared injured as gunmen believed to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Maikadiri village in Askira-Uba Local Government Area. The attack came at night. Some violence spilled into the following day.
On 11 November, Boko Haram elements raided the residence of a man in Waramide, Sandawadjiri: his two wives were kidnapped.

At least two persons were killed and many others feared injured as gunmen believed to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Maikadiri village in Askira-Uba Local Government Area. The attack came at night. Some violence spilled into the following day.
Four members of Boko Haram attacked Muktum village of Gujba LGA, targeting and killing one of the attacker's father.

assoc_actor_1: Sabongari Chambula Communal Militia (Nigeria); Vigilante Group (Nigeria)
notes: Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari and Kafin Hausa on the night of 15/11. The attackers killed many livestock, and looted and burnt many houses before they were repelled by security forces. No reported deaths. The attackers were repelled by soldiers, hunters and members of the local vigilante.

Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari and Kafin Hausa on the night of 15/11. The attackers killed many livestock, and looted and burnt many houses before they were repelled by security forces. No reported deaths. The attackers were repelled by soldiers, hunters and members of the local vigilante.
Four suicide bombers attack the Muna area, killing twelve civilians (this figure was later raised to 18, plus 29 injured), including themselves.
Three Boko Haram suicide bombers (two detonated) attack Maiduguri on 18/11, killing two (plus two bombers). Xinhua claims five dead and four wounded.

Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Alakaramtii village of Jere LGA in two waves. The bombers were teen-aged females. The first came in the "wee" hours of the day, the second at 0600hrs. The one of the bombers in the second pair took off her vest and placed in next to a house before fleeing. At least four dead, including the three bombers.
Boko Haram insurgents have beheaded six farmers at Dimge plantation, in Mafa Local Government Area of Borno State. Seven others were abducted.
Boko Haram attacks Lawati village in Jere, kills six.
5 dead and a dozen wounded in this morning's suicide bombing in Kolofata.

At least 50 people were killed when a suicide bomber blew himself up in a mosque in Adamawa State. The attack was blamed on Boko Haram. The blast happened during early morning prayers at the Madina mosque in the Unguwar Shuwa area of Mubi.

Air forces destroy a Boko Haram ammunitions base 23km south of Konduga. The strikes took place over two days, though the specific dates are not revealed by the source. An military announcement of the operation was made on 22/11. No reported causalities.
Local hunters pursued and killed a Boko Haram cattle thief in Gur, Borno State. (Boko Haram often steal livestock to finance their operation.)
On 23 November, 3 Boko Haram supporters were killed by Boko Haram elements in Dougdje, Kolofata.
Boko Haram kills seven farm workers at Sabon Gari in Gombi LGA.
Nigerian air forces strike a "large gathering" of Boko Haram at Bogumari on 24/11. Causalities reported, number not known.
Military forces clear Abusuriwa, Newchina, Bonzon, Usmanari, Goyayeri, Shitimari, Gashimari and Awaram villages in Bama Local Government Area of Boko Haram elements. Eight dead, 30 rescued.
Military forces engage Boko Haram at Kumshe and Dar el Jamal villages, six Boko Haram dead.
Military forces engage Boko Haram at Kumshe and Dar el Jamal villages, six Boko Haram dead.
Military forces clear Abusuriwa, Newchina, Bonzon, Usmanari, Goyayeri, Shitimari, Gashimari and Awaram villages in Bama Local Government Area of Boko Haram elements. Eight dead, 30 rescued.
Boko Haram attacks Magumeri during the evening hours. Military forces repulsed the attack. Three soldiers dead, six injured; one civilian dead, three injured.
One villager was killed in Sanda-Wadjiri. No further details.
On 27 November, Boko Haram elements attacked a truck in Gassama, Logone et Chari, wounding the driver. The other travellers went missing.
A truck was attacked on the national No.1 between Dabanga and Gouess. Three missing, one injured.
Nigerian air forces strike a "large gathering" of Boko Haram at Gobars (near Gwoza) on 28/11. Causalities reported, number not known.
Military forces kill four Boko Haram fighters, capture a commander ("Ameer" of Chawa, Amman Judee) and rescue 212 hostages during an operation in Sambisa.

Two people were killed when Boko Haram fighters attacked Wanu village, some three kilometres (just under two miles) from the town of Gulak, at about 7:30 pm (1830 GMT) on Wednesday. The Sun reports 5 dead.
Boko Haram killed a soldier and wounded three others in a raid on a military post in Gajibo village near Dikwa. Military forces announced the following week that they had killed three Boko Haram.
Two villagers killed and a girl kidnapped in Tchebetchebe.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: A 42nd BIM vehicle hit an IED at Hodogo. 4 injured.

source: Agence France Presse; Vanguard (Lagos); Sunday Trust
notes: 25 people were killed and 53 wounded in a dual suicide bomb attack at a busy morning market in Biu on 02/12. No group has claimed responsibility, though Boko Haram is believed responsible.

A group of armed individuals suspected of being affiliated with the Islamist sect Boko Haram abducted ten people and killed two others after raiding a village in the Tchebe-Tchebe locality, Far North region.
Military forces neutralize three Boko Haram members at Sabsabwa.
Military forces neutralize four Boko Haram members at Miyanti-Darel Jamel.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.

The attack was complex; Eighteen Boko Haram on foot attacked the military base while seven suicide bombers targeted residents of nearby Bale Shuwar and Alikaranti villages at 8:50 pm. The chief security officer at the State Emergency Management Agency initially claimed 18 dead, though that figure was raised to 20 after two wounded succumbed to injures. Among the counted dead were six foot soldiers and 7 suicide bombers. 84 others wounded.

source: Daily Trust (Abuja); Agence France Presse; Vanguard
notes: 01 April. 29 are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Bale Galtimari, Bale-Shuwa, Bale-Kura and Alikaranti areas in Jere LGA. The attack was complex; Eighteen Boko Haram on foot attacked the military base while seven suicide bombers targeted residents of nearby Bale Shuwar and Alikaranti villages at 8:50 pm. The chief security officer at the State Emergency Management Agency initially claimed 18 dead, though that figure was raised to 20 after two wounded succumbed to injures. Among the counted dead were six foot soldiers and 7 suicide bombers. 84 others wounded.
On 2 April, the Cameroonian army post in Amtalia, Waza, was attacked by BH men and kamikazes. 2 kamikazes dead and 1 soldier wounded.
On 2 April, BH elements attacked a military post in Sagme, Fotokol. 5 soldiers and 15 BH men dead; 3 soldiers wounded. The attacked soldiers were those who participated in the Gomaram operation.
On 2 April, a man was killed by BH men following an attack in Mogbere, Limani.
06 April. The Nigerian Army killed five Boko Haram insurgents in a gun battle at Barkin-Dutse Area of Adamawa on 06/04.
On 7 April, Cameroonian forces ambushed BH men at Double bridge (Mora): 1 dead among BH men. Bikes and food were seized.
07 April. Military forces kill between 3-5 Boko Haram and rescue 149 of their hostages during an encounter at Yerimari Kura.
On 8 April, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Alagarno (Kolofata) killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.
09 April. Military forces killed three Boko Haram insurgents in two separate encounters in Mujigine general area.
On 9 April, Boko Haram elements kidnapped 2 truck drivers between Mada and Zigague.
11 April. Military forces kill three Boko Haram, rescue 33 hostages in Jere LGA. Exact location not known.
On 11 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Amichde: 2 people wounded.

source: This Day (Lagos); Twitter; Local Source Project
notes: 11 April. Nigeria air forces conducted air strikes against Boko Haram locations at Arege and Tumbun Rago in Borno State. 20 believed dead.

source: This Day (Lagos); Twitter; Local Source Project
notes: 11 April. Nigeria air forces conducted air strikes against Boko Haram locations at Arege and Tumbun Rago in Borno State. 20 believed dead.
13 April. Military air forces strike a Boko Haram position 12km East of Arege. Vehicles reportedly destroyed. An estimated 40 dead in the strike.
14 April. On or before 14 April - Military forces killed two Boko Haram members fleeing from Sambisa Forest at Kusheri-Ardodam along Magumeri in Borno. The troops also recovered ammunition.
14 April. On or before 14 April - Military forces killed three members of Boko Haram at Multe-Lawanti, South of Furfur in Damboa, Borno, and recovered one AK 47 rifle and three motorcycles.

15 April. Three Chadian soldiers under the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) were killed on Sunday, April 15, during clashes with Boko Haram militants in Borno state. According to local sources, the clashes took place in Arge (Abadam district), near the Chad-Nigeria border.
On 16 April, 2 fishermen were killed by Boko Haram in Ngame, Waza.
On 18 April, Zigague vigilantes tracked Boko Haram elements and killed 4, arrested 1. They recovered also 150 cattle heads, sezied by Boko Haram.
On 18 April, Boko Haram men attacked Zalala, Zigague and seized a cattle herd. One wounded.
19 April. Military forces kill a member of Boko Haram; neutralize a potential attack on Gambaru.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: 21 April. Three soldiers, two members of the Civilian JTF and three members of Boko Haram are dead in a confrontation believe to be in the Magumeri area. Soldier of the same Brigade also rescued three civilians.

22 April. Two Boko Haram suicide bombers between the ages of 13 to 14 years and two worshippers lost their lives when the bombers invaded a mosque around Bama Dina ward of Bama. There were many other injuries. The attack occurred during the early morning hours. The Sun reports 12 dead.
22 April. Military forces destroy a Boko Haram camp in Afa, kill a militant and rescue a hostage.
22 April. 5 Boko Haram were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation at Buk. 5 captives were also rescued.

22 April. Troops acting on intelligence discovered a Boko Haram camp in Benisheikh, used for providing instructional training materials. During the encounter; the troops killed 1 of the insurgent and rescued a hostage from the training camp.
22 April. Military forces destroy a Boko Haram IED factory and camp in Buk, kill an unknown number of insurgents and rescue hostages.
22 April. Boko Haram attack and kills 18 wood collectors near Gamboru.
22 April. A military convoy struck a Boko Haram land mine near Wumbi. Three deaths reported.
23 April. Military forces neutralize three Boko Haram suicide bombers as they were trying to gain entry into Bama town.

24 April. Fulanis attack Tse-Umenge, Mbadwen council ward, Mbakpase, Saghev council ward and Tse-Ali, Mbawa council ward in Guma LGA over two days; 39 dead. Tse-Ali had been attacked by Fulanis over the weekend as well. Military forces captured a suspect in the following days; the attackers may have had an association with Boko Haram, but describes the attackers as "militia herdsmen."
On 24 April, 2 Boko Haram elements were killed by Cameroonian soldiers in Cherif Moussari, Kolofata.

25 April. Fulanis attack Tse-Umenge, Mbadwen council ward, Mbakpase, Saghev council ward and Tse-Ali, Mbawa council ward in Guma LGA over two days; 39 dead. Tse-Ali had been attacked by Fulanis over the weekend as well. Military forces captured a suspect in the following days; the attack may have had an association with Boko Haram, but describes the attackers as "militia herdsmen."
26 April. Boko Haram fighters attempted to overrun Maiduguri, but were repelled by Nigerian Military Forces.

26 April. Military and police forces repel a Boko Haram attack on the Jidari-Polo (Giwa Barracks) area of Maiduguri. The ensuring gun battle lasted two hours. At least four civilians and five suicide bombers died in the encounter. The attack caused thousands to flee.

28 April, on or before. Military forces capture three Fulani suspects believed responsible for recent attack against civilians in Guma LGA following a firefight in Tormatar village in Guma. The suspect may have an association with Boko Haram, though the source describes the suspect(s) as "militia herdsmen." Source dated on 28/04; date of actual operation not known. No causalities.
28 April. An air force strike against a Boko Haram location in Yerwa neutralizes "several." The Sun reports "scores" dead.

On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Bia, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle seized.

source: Daily Trust (Abuja); This Day (Lagos); The Sun (Nigeria); Vanguard
notes: 01 May. The Daily Trust reports twin suicide bombers which killed 27 and injured 64 in Mubi. This Day reports 60 dead; the Sun, 68. However, in a report published the following will the causality figure stood at "more than 20." The first explosion occurred in a mosque, while a second occurred in a market. Perpetrators believed to be Boko Haram. It is not known if the perpetrators were present at the time of detonation.
Around 1 May, the village chief of Kalama, Makary was kidnapped by Boko Haram. He was freed on 6 May after a ransom was paid.
On 1 May, a truck was hit by a landmine planted by Boko Haram men in Madina, Makari. Severe material damages but no physical harm.
02 May. Military and Boko Haram forces clash in Auno. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.

On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army promted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.

The intervention of the Cameroonian army promted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.
On 3 May, a man was killed during a Boko Haram incursion in Tcherive, Mayo-Sava. 20 huts burned.
04 May. Four Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Mainari Kanuri and Shua villages killing themselves and three others.
On 5 May, a man was killed at his field in Krawamafa by Boko Haram men.
On 7 May, a man was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa, Mayo-Tsanaga.

notes: 7 or 8 May. Nigerian Air Forces conduct strikes against a IS Boko Haram location at Koleram, which is in Kala/Balge LGA. "Scores" reported dead (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
On or around 9 May 2018, Boko Haram soldiers attacked the Nigerian army barracks near the village of Shitmari (most likely in Borno state) and seized weapons, amunitions, and military equipments.
09 May. Boko Haram attacks Kongulon Village in Konduga and killed 2 people.

09 May. Two suicide bombers attempt to attack a Jiddari area Mosque in Maiduguri while worshippers were observing their early morning prayers. The pair was however chased away by a group of vigilantes, after which they detonated their packs. Both bombers dead.
13 May. Military forces engage and kill two Boko Haram members at Gobara, Gwoza LGA.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force

15 May. Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack in Gashager, killing 6 and injuring others. Two soldiers were reportedly wounded. The soldiers also cleared Gambori, Dumbawa, Damsu, Awardi, Kanaram, Laridi, Malumdi and Yuramdi villages and recovered weapons.
15 May. Nigerian and Cameroonian forces kill four fleeing Boko Haram members in Firgi and Moula, both in Bama and Dikwa Local Governments Areas of Borno State, respectively.
15 May. Nigerian and Cameroonian forces kill four fleeing Boko Haram members in Firgi and Moula, both in Bama and Dikwa Local Governments Areas of Borno State, respectively.

15 May. Air forces strike Boko Haram locations 13 nautical miles north east of Bama. The strike destroyed buildings and killed "most" of the Boko Haram in the area.
17 May. At least four people were killed in a Boko Haram suicide blast at a Dikwa mosque.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion

Arrests: 20 May. A group of 'brave civilians' prevented a Boko Haram suicide bomber from attacking a Mosque in Gashua village, Gujba Local Government Area. The potential attacker was arrested.

On 30 May, a Boko Haram incursion was repelled by a vigilante milita in Mada Kolo, Ndiguina, Logone et Chari. One BH killed and another captured.
31 May. Five military members are dead following the detonation of an Boko Haram IED on a road between Pidang - Bita village of Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno state.

01 June. 3 Boko Haram members were shot dead by soldiers during a clearance operation of Jaje, Angwa Audu, Major Ali, Dabu Abdullahi, Dabu Wulkaro and Gori Jaji (all coordinates are approx) in Guzamala LGA. 9 hostages including 2 aged men , 2 females and 5 children were also rescued.

03 June. Military forces encounter Boko Haram along Wulgo - Ngelkona near Ngelkona in Ngala Local Government Area of Borno state. Ten Boko Haram dead; a large amount of money recovered.
On 3 June, Cameroonian soldiers repelled an attack by Boko Haram men in Zuru, Amchide.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On June 4, three presumed Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated their explosive belts at three separate locations including a quaranic school in the Diffa Koura area of Diffa, killing 10 people and wounding 37 others.
04 June. Boko Haram ambushes a group of military forces in "north-east" Nigeria (likely Borno State), killing five in the ensuing firefight.

07 June. 1 Boko Haram element was killed by troops of 145 Battalion during a clearance operation in Gashigar, Abadam LGA. The troops recovered AK 47 rifle and one magazine loaded with 25 rounds 7.62mm.
07 June. 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed by soldiers. The bombers attempted to infiltrate the community of Mandanari, Konduga but were intercepted by operatives.
07 June. Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram fighters in Lokodisa village in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno. Four Boko Haram fatalities.
On 8 June, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Djalingo, Dogba. 10 civilians, including the village Lawan, and 10 BH men killed.
09 June. A police officer is killed in a Boko Haram suicide attack at the Monday market area of Maiduguri. A second report claims only the bomber died.

11 June. Military forces clear a Boko Haram location "in the Lake Chad region, Gwoza LGA." 23 dead, weapons recovered. The patrolling forces also cleared the locations of Bulakeisa, Tumbuma Babba, Abbaganaram and Dan Baure without violence. The operation was done in conjunction with Cameroon forces.

actor1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: 11 June. A Boko Haram suicide bomber attacked a Civilian JTF position in Maiduguri killing one and injuring four others. Two dead total.
11 June. Boko Haram members attack Kaya village during the late night hours, destroying property. The attackers were repelled by a group of resident vigilantes. One Boko Haram member dead.
On 12 June, Boko Haram killed a man in Alladjiri, Kerawa.
13 June. A Boko Haram commander is killed by security forces after the group attacked 13 unnamed villages in Michika LGA. The status of the civilian populace in the villages is not known.
13 June. A Boko Haram commander is killed by security forces after the group attacked 13 unnamed villages in Michika LGA. The status of the civilian populace in the villages is not known.

On 16 June, two people were killed by BH men in Tchika, Lac Tchad.
19 June. Boko Haram attacks Gajiram and are repelled by local police. Soldiers, who also engaged the attackers, reported 9 dead and two wounded.
On 20 June, a vigiliante was killed during a BH attack in Blabline, Logone et Chari

20 June. Fifteen people were injured when two female Boko Haram suicide bombers targeted the edge of a military barracks in Maidguri in northeast Nigeria. One of the bombers was neutralized by security forces before her pack was detonated. The two bombers were the only fatalities.
21 June. Boko Haram attacks a group of local farmers in Mafa of Borno State, beheading 3 and leaving 13 others with gunshot wounds.

22 June. A male suicide bomber attacks Tungushe village, 6km north of Maiduguri during the night-time hours. Following the blast Boko Haram attacked the village with small arms. At least five people were killed and six others injured.

Approximate coordinates used for all 8 locations.

On 26 June, 4 BH men were killed in Gogo/Blamederie, Mayo Sava during an army operation.

29 June, on or before. Military forces attack and overtake Gasawa Village in Guzamala LGA during a clearance operation. Four Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. The military made the announcement of the operation on 29 June.

29 June. Boko Haram members, disguised as farmers attacked a group of farmers along Damboa- Bitta- Gwoza road, killing four.

10 July. Boko Haram attack Luru (Lubu) location, Girei LGA, killing five. Following the attack the attackers raised the Boko Haram flag over the town.

13-14 July. 23 Nigerian soldiers went missing after Boko Haram ambushed a convoy outside Bama at Boboshe village, leading to the loss of several military vehicles. According to a military officer, 'around 100 terrorists' attacked the convoy. Any causalities/fatalities not known. The attack may have lasted into the early hours of the following morning. The military later denied the attack took place.

notes: 14 July. Nearly 100 soldiers are missing after Boko Haram elements overruns a base in Jilli, along the border between Yobe and Borno States. 27 July. Military ground forces, supported by air forces, neutralize 16 members of Boko Haram and recover weapons in Mairari, Monguno LGA.
27 July. Boko Haram attacks a military location at Bunari, Monguno LGA (coordinates approx), killing 11 soldiers. The attack is believed to be retaliation from a military offensive in nearby Mairari.
On 28 July, the son of the local chief was kidnapped by BH militants in Maigobouri, Mayo Moskota. His body wound found on 30 July.
On 28 July, BH men attacked Hina killing 5 men and kidnapping 1.

29 July. Air forces launch an attack on a Boko Haram position at Tongule, 9km SW of Dikwa (approx coordinates used). As a result of the air strikes, several Boko Haram were neutralised in the village while a few survivors, seen fleeing the location, were taken out in subsequent follow-up attacks. Exact causality numbers not known - The Sun claims "scores."
On 29 July, at least 4 civilians were killed by a suspected BH landmine explosion in Blamahadji village on the route to Banki, Nigeria.
On 31 July, a Boko Haram man was killed during clashes with the Cameroonian army in Amchide.
On 2 August, Nigerian soldiers ambushed BH militants around Malari village, Borno State, killing two and forcing the others to flee into the bush.

notes: 03 August. Suspected Barnawi faction Boko Haram attacks Gasarwa village (Monguno LGA) during the late hours. At least five fatalities, homes destroyed.

04 August, on or before. Military forces launch a mass clearance operation of suspects believed to have taken part in recent attacks on Zurmi LGA villages. Forces cleared Mashema, Kwadi, Kagara, Gambiru (coordinates approx). The exact date of the operations is not known. Two perpetrator kingpins were neutralized in Yanwari and Mai Tukunya (coordinates approx). At least 20 fatalities.
On 3 August, Nigerian airstrikes on BH men in Daban Masara, Monguno, Borno, were launched. Several dead reported (unknown coded as 10).

On 5 August, at least 2 suspected BH suicide bombers exploded themselves in the Kalari area of Maiduguri, Borno, killing only themselves and wounding 3 civilians. Some sources mention five suicide bombers.
On 5 August, BH men attacked the Ngame village, 15km from Waza, firing shots in the air that forced the populations to flee and looting the entire village.
On 6 August, BH men attacked the Munduri village, 13km north of Maiduguri, Borno (approx. coordinates used). 7 civilians, caught while fleeing, were executed.

On 6 August, the Nigerian army repelled an attack coordinated by Boko Haram insurgents on a military formation at Gundari, Guzamala Local Government Area of Borno. 7 BH men killed and 8 soldiers wounded.
On 6 August, BH men attacked the Zaman village, 17 km from Makary, killing one vigilante.

On 8 August, BH men attacked the Afade village: 7 BH killed and 1 arrested after clashes with Cameroonian soldiers.

On 8 August, BH men attacked the military bas of Garunda village, Borno State, killing 17 soldiers and wounding 14. An unspecified number is still unaccounted. BH men looted weapons and vehicles before fleeing.
