notes: 05 November. Boko Haram attacked soldiers in Kumshe. IS-backed Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the attack, but Shekau released a video also claiming responsibility. The video contained the ISWAP flag, possibly signaling reconciliation between the factions according to some sources.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 05 November. Boko Haram IS attacked the military base and market in Kukawa. Sixteen soldiers went missing and one civilian was killed in the crossfire according to local sources. IS later claimed that 15 soldiers were killed.
06 November. Boko Haram killed a member of a vigilante committee group in Tchika during the night and abducted the man's seven children.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 07 November. The IS-aligned Boko Haram faction released a video claiming to have killed a man whom they accused of spying for the JTF in Chek (no coordinates available).
07 November. Boko Haram and soldiers exchanged fire when the group attacked Katarko village (aka Bujimirum). The soldiers then retreated.
07 November. Boko Haram arrived in trucks and attacked Katarko village (aka Bujimirum). They also set fires to homes in the town.
08 November. The military repelled an attack by Boko Haram on its base in Kagarko (coordinates are approximate based on location 41 km north of Buni Yadi).
09 November. Military forces pushed Boko Haram out of Guzamala and recaptured villages in the area. Two Boko Haram leaders were killed and sixteen abductees were freed.
09 November. The air force launched strikes on Boko Haram camps in Talala (no coordinates available). 'Several' members of the group were killed (coded as 10).
10 November. Boko Haram attacked Bale Shuwa (no coordinates available). One disabled person was killed, homes were burned down, and livestock was stolen.
10 November. Boko Haram attacked Jimmi (no coordinates available), a town 5 km from Maiduguri. The attackers fired their weapons and set homes and tents from an informal IDP camp on fire.
11 November. Military forces killed one member of Boko Haram and captured another in Mozogo.
13 November. Two Boko Haram members on a motorcycle fired on farmers in Gremari, killing one.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 13 November. IS-aligned Boko Haram members killed 15 farmers in Kazaa and Daraa (no coordinates available), 5 km from Monguno. The fatalities have been disaggregated between locations (8 for Kazaa and 7 for Daraa).
14 November. Boko Haram attacked Mammanti, a town next to Maiduguri. One person was killed. The attackers burned down homes and looted supplies from the village.
14 November. The air force launched operation Green Sweep, targeting Boko Haram sites near Sambisa.
14 November. The air force carried out strikes on a Boko Haram camp in Buk.
15 November. Air forces launched strikes on a Boko Haram site 3km southwest of Tumbun Rego. Vehicles and supplies were destroyed. 'Several' members of Boko Haram were killed (coded as 10).

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)

Weapons and military equipments were also seized.

On November 16, in Gogo village (Mayo-Sava, Extreme Nord), Boko Haram militants attacked the village, injured five people, burned huts, and stole three motorcycles.

16 November. Boko Haram attacked a military base in Kekeno. The groups clashed for three hours but with the help from reinforcements the military was able to repel the attackers. One fatality was reported.

01 January. Military forces of Nigeria launched attacks against Boko Haram in the villages of Yachidan, Korongolen, Bambula and Forfor. In Forfor soldiers killed one Boko Haram fighter and arrested two.

01 January (or around). Nigerian Military launched operations against Boko Haram in the villages of Baga, Goniri, Damasak, Cross Kauwa and Monguno. Spokesperson of the army reported that 100 Boko Haram fighters were killed. Fatalities split between events.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On January 1, IS-affiliated Boko Haram (ISWAP) engaged in battles with the Nigerian military and overran their posts in four areas: in Buni Gari town (Gujba, Yobe); Kimba town (Biu, Borno); Sabon Gari town (Hawul, Borno) and Biu LGA (Borno). 14 fatalities reported in total - spread across the four locations.

18 March. Boko Haram members kill a civilian during an attack on Goumouldi of Kolofata.
17-18 March. 20 Boko Haram members attack Tayer village in Mayo-Sava, killing 1 civilian and looting 7 shops.

18 March. Boko Haram attacked Michika, robbed a bank and some shops in the town before they were stopped by Nigerian Military Forces and eventually withdrew. 11 BH fighters killed in the battle, five civilians also died.
18 March. A civilian-military convoy hit a landmine planted by Boko Haram at Warabe village. Eight people killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 19, presumed ISWAP militants abducted two women in the village of Ngagam.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 19, presumed ISWAP militants beheaded an individual in N'Gayam, 1km from Ngagam.

19 March. Lassa communal militas engaged Boko Haram in gun fight in Lassa. BH was withdrewing from Michika to Sambisa Forest and lost several fighters in the Lassa battle. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
19 March. After clashing with local militias and losing several fighters, Boko Haram launched a reprisal attack on Lassa and killed four farmers outside the village

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 21, presumed ISWAP militants attacked the village of Dewa Kargueri and killed eight civilians and wounded 20 others.
21 March. Boko Haram attack Lake Chad locations near Waza of Logone-Et-Chari, kidnapping 1 fisherman, stealing over 700 cattle and forcing others to flee.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
source: AFP; RFI; Xinhua; Tchad Actuel; Tchadinfos
notes: On March 22, presumed ISWAP militants attacked a Chadian army position in Dandallah, 23 soldiers were killed and others wounded, the militants seized arms and equipment before withdrawing.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 23, an ISWAP faction reportedly killed five members of Shekau's Boko Haram faction and captured five others in Djaboullam.
23 March. Boko Haram attack civilians in Zagague of Waza, killing one civilian and stealing cattle.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 23, presumed ISWAP militants attacked the village of Morom Karimboa and killed two civilians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 23, presumed ISWAP militants attacked the village of Ngagam and killed six civilians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 23, presumed ISWAP militants attacked the village of Boula Kiassa and killed one civilian.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
source: Urgence Diffa; Toute l'actualite sur Diffa; Jeunesse DIFFA
notes: On March 23, presumed ISWAP militants attacked the hamlet of Ehl Mainari, and killed four civilians.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 23, presumed ISWAP militants attacked the village of Kaya and killed one civilian.
24 March. Boko Haram forces attack civilians in Goulouzivini locality of Waza, killing a woman.
24 March. Boko Haram members attack Kerawa of Kolofata, wounding a civilian and destroying a classroom.
25 March. Boko Haram attacks civilians in Zelevet of Mokolo, leaving one civilian severely injured and stealing food.
25 March. Boko Haram attacked Kofa village in Borno and was repelled by Nigerian Armed Forces. BH fighters burned down houses and looted the villages

source: AFP; RFI; Actu (Niger); Jeune Afrique; Aniamey
notes: On March 26, Boko Haram militants (reports indicate Shekau's or an autonomous ISWAP faction), carried out an incursion into the town of N'Guigmi, at least two suicide bombers detonated themselves, many houses in Dileram (quarter harboring IDPs) were burned, 12 people were killed including family members of gendarmes and several wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 27 March. Boko Haram IS invaded parts of Miringa and shot at a military school. Nigerian Armed Forces engaged BH in gun fight and repelled the attack
28 March. Boko Haram attacked Gatamwarwa and was repelled by Nigerian Military Forces. Several houses were torched

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 29, presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants abducted three youths in Lada, one managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 29 March (or 30 March). Boko Haram and BIR military forces clash near Limani-Gourgui area of Kolofata, killing 2 Boko Haram members and retrieving military equipment.

actor1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
notes: 31 March (or around). The Multinational Taskforce clashed with Boko Haram in Andakar, Kirinowa area. A BH base was destroyed and 15 BH fighters were killed.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On March 31, ISWAP claimed to have to have assassinated an individual accused of being a spy of the coalition in the town of Diffa.
01 April. Boko Haram set the Kaumutiyah village on fire.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 01 April. Nigerian Airforce bombed a camp of Boko Haram IS at Magari in Northern Borno state and killed several BH fighters. Unknown fatalities coded as 10

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-); Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: 01 April. Boko Haram IS published a video showing the execution of five Nigerian soldiers in Borno. Military forces claimed that three of them were members of civilian militias

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On April 2, ISWAP claimed to have detonated an IED against a vehicle of the Multinational Joint Task Force near Toumour, killing the occupants of the vehicle, unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
Between 05-09 April. 2 soldiers are abducted and killed by Boko Haram members near Ardebe of Makary.
06 April. Two Boko Haram suicide bombers killed themselves and three civilians in the outskirts of Maiduguri when their IED vests detonated in the Muna-Dalti area of the city. 45 people were injured.

06 or 07 April. Boko Haram forces clash with soldiers in Sagme of Hile Alifa. 3 soldiers were killed, 4 wounded and another missing following the clash. A number of Boko Haram militants were also neutralized (unknown coded as 10).

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 07 April. Boko Haram faction of Islamic State clash with military forces in Fotokol of Hile Alifa, killing or injuring 20 soldiers. Unknown if dead or injured coded as 0 fatalities.
07 April. Military forces clash with Boko Haram members in Gambaru area of Ngala. No casualties were reported.

On April 8, presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants carried out an incursion into the area of Toumour, two civilians killed including one had the throat slit and the other shot dead, and a notable wounded.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On April 8, ISWAP militants launched a barrage of Grad rockets targeting the Diffa Airport harboring the Multinational Joint Task Force and the military base, the attack did not cause any casualties, and the projectiles fell hundred meters outside the perimeter of the facilities.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 08 April. Nigerian Airforce bombed a Boko Haram IS camp at Tumbun Zarami in northern Borno and neutralized "several" fighters. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 09 April. Boko Haram IS attacked Damaturu and engaged in a battle with Nigerian Military Forces. Military forces seized gun trucks and weapons. No fatalities reported yet.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
source: Xinhua; AFP; RFI; Actu (Niger); Amaq; Nashir News Agency
notes: On April 9, four ISWAP militants equipped with small arms and hand grenades attacked the town of Diffa, they targeted the gendarmerie and the customs, clashes raged overnight and two gendarmes were killed and at least four gendarmes wounded, all assailants killed.

On April 9, presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants killed the village chief in Gremari and abducted two individuals including the father and the niece of the secretary general at the mayor's office of Maine Soroa.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On April 10, ISWAP claimed destroying a vehicle of the Multinational Joint Task Force by detonation of an IED near Toumour, and killing and wounding seven of the occupants, fatalities coded as 3.

source: Urgence Diffa; Toute l'actualite sur Diffa; Jeunesse Diffa
notes: On April 11, a plow was struck by an IED presumably planted by ISWAP/Boko Haram militants in the area of Bougi, two civilians were killed, one wounded, as well as livestock killed.
12 April. Boko Haram detonate an IED within a military vehicle, killing one person and injuring 8 others in Kerawa of Kolofata.
12 April. 4 soldiers are killed by Boko Haram after an IED was triggered near their vehicle near the axis of Vouzi-Vreket-Gouzda in Mayo Moskota.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: On April 12, ISWAP claimed destroying a tank of the Multinational Joint Task Force by detonation of an IED near Toumour, and killing the occupants, unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On April 13, presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants aboard motorbikes shot dead an individual and burned the corps in Biri Boula.
Night of 13 April. Military forces clash with Boko Haram members in Sandawadjiri of Kolofata, killing 2 Boko Haram members.

notes: 14 April: Boko Haram militants raided the Kwarangulum village (16 KMs from Chibok town) and set several homes on fire after looting food and other necessary items. The residents escaped when they saw that some group of armed men were coming toward them. No casualties reported

On April 15, presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants attacked a Chadian army postion in the area of Bohouma, seven soldiers were killed and 15 wounded, authorities said that 63 militants were killed in a counter-attack.
On April 16 presumed ISWAP/Boko Haram militants attacked a gendarmerie position in Dabantchali (coded as Koultime at geoprecision 2), and killed one gendarme and wounded three others.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 16 April: Boko Haram attacked Chadian soldiers in Cross Kaura in the Magorone area (100 KMs north of Maiduguri) and killed two. Military repeled them kiling 53. Chadian soldiers were sent to Nigeria end February to support Nigerian soldiers in defeating Boko Haram
16 April. Boko Haram members kill 3 civilians in Kerawa of Kolofata while they are fetching firewood.
18 April. Boko Haram members attack civilians, steal goods, and burn property in Tchakamari of Mayo-Sava, killing 7 civilians, injuring 5 others.
